Dialogue:
Person1: 657-2036
Person2: Hello -- who is this?
Person1: This is Dr. Smith's answering service.
Person2: Is the doctor anywhere?
Person1: Well -- you see -- the doctor is at his son's wedding, but I'm sure it's over by now. He should be checking in any moment --
Person2: Listen to me. I am Dr. Smith's brother -- Reverend Smith -- and I am supposed to perform the ceremony. I just got in -- from -- Portland -- and I've forgotten what church -- you see?
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to inform Person2, who claims to be Dr. Smith's brother Reverend Smith, that Dr. Smith is at his son's wedding and should be checking in soon, but Person2 is urgently trying to remember the location of the church for the ceremony.
Intent_p2: Person2 is urgently seeking information about the location of the church where he is supposed to perform a ceremony.

Dialogue:
Person1: Allison? Why can't remember what happened to my wife? Is it something I'm on that's... that's making me forget?
Person2: Easy there Trevor. You need to relax.
Person1: No I need to remember. Look whatever it is take me off it. I can handle pain. I can't handle not knowing...
Person2: You need to get better first Trevor. Way better.  It's okay to miss somebody. It's okay to still love someone after they're gone. But you've got to quit blaming yourself okay...? Okay?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern about his memory loss and is questioning if medication is causing it, while also feeling guilty and wanting to remember what happened to his wife.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to reassure Trevor that it's important for him to focus on his own well-being and healing, rather than blaming himself for his wife's disappearance.

Dialogue:
Person1: Fox, Bud D. is this deja vu or has it really been a year. You're not hitting me up for NYU are you?
Person2: Well we're thinking of putting up a statue of you in the subway. I hear you're moving up in the world. An associate already. Not bad. How's Margie?
Person1: Can't complain. Got a house in Oyster Bay. Market treating you good? Still seeing that sexy French gal?
Person2: Nah, she asked the wrong question.
Person1: What was that?
Person2: "What are you thinking?"...that was it. The hours are hell, but the money's starting to tumble in. I know this guy who's got an iron- clad way to make money, I can't lose and I can't get hurt.
Person1: So, does "this guy" have a tip for an honest lawyer?
Person2: Yeah, check out Teldar Paper, it's still not over.
Person1: Okay.
Person2: What about you, I hear you guys are handling the Fairchild Foods merger and it may not be going through. Any surprises I haven't read about in the Wall Street Journal?
Person1: Come on Buddy, you wouldn't want to got me disbarred now would you?
Person2: Who's listening? It's just one college buddy talking to another.
Person1: Yeah, right...
Person2: Relax, Roger, everybody's doing it but you don't know, you don't know.
Person1: ...and if I did, what's in it for moi?
Intent_p1: Person1 is subtly expressing caution and skepticism about potentially engaging in unethical or illegal activities with Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2 is subtly hinting at insider trading and offering to share potentially lucrative information with Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: I have this thing where I have to know a person is being honest with me before, you know, I can feel completely free to be myself.
Person2: We're strangers in the night. The last thing we want is honesty.
Person1: What do we want?
Person2: Mystery. Deception.
Person1: Deception isn't something I personally consider sexy.
Person2: What's sexy?
Person1: Knowing who a person is. Down deep.
Person2: Even if the truth about a person is sad or depressing or shocking?
Person1: You won't even tell me your name. What's shocking about a name?
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses the importance of knowing a person deeply and authentically before feeling comfortable to be themselves.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that in their interaction with Person1, they prefer mystery and deception over honesty, as they believe that is what is desired in their current dynamic as strangers.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...Come in here...I work here, I don't come in here to be mistreated...
Person2: Go to lunch, will you...
Person1: I want to work today, that's why I came...
Person2: The leads come in, I'll let...
Person1: ...that's why I came in.  I thought I...
Person2: Just go to lunch.
Person1: I don't want to go to lunch.
Person2: Go to lunch, George.
Person1: Where does he get off to talk that way to a working man?  It's not...
Person2: Will you take it outside, we have people trying to do business here...
Person1: That's what, that's what, that's what I was trying to do.  That's why I came in...I meet gestapo tac...
Person2: Excuse me...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration about being mistreated at work and wanting to continue working instead of going to lunch.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to ask Person1 to take their conversation outside as there are people trying to conduct business in the area.

Dialogue:
Person1: Looks like we got a couple of live ones. How long these boys in for?
Person2: Judge gave 'em the long ride.
Person1: Life, huh? They step outta line again, we'll shorten up that sentence real fast.
Intent_p1: Person1 is indicating that the individuals have received a life sentence, and if they misbehave, their punishment will be swiftly increased.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to convey that the judge sentenced the boys to life in prison and that any future misbehavior will result in a quick punishment.

Dialogue:
Person1: Now, wait a minute, Dad...
Person2: Sure. What's worth doing is worth doing for money. It's a bad bargain where nobody gains. And if this deal goes through, we all gain.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing hesitation or disagreement with their father's perspective on the importance of doing things for money.
Intent_p2: Person2 is emphasizing the importance of being compensated for valuable work and highlighting the mutual benefit that can be achieved through a particular deal.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm going to kill myself.
Person2: Why?
Person1: Because you think I'm all like... "Hey man, check me out".
Person2: No, I don't think you're like, "I'm charming and mysterious in a way that even I don't understand and something about me is crying out for protection from a big man like you".  Very hard to compete with.  Especially to us married women who have lost our mystery.
Person1: But you haven't lost your mystery! You're very mysterious!
Person2: No.  I'm weird.  Weird and mysterious are two different things.
Person1: But I'm weird.
Person2: No.  You're quirky.  Quirky and weird are two different things.
Person1: Peggy, there's distinct possibility that I might be profoundly and irreversibly screwed up.  Despite that, I love you and I can promise that I will no longer flirt with Cory, and I beg your forgiveness.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing feelings of inadequacy and seeking forgiveness for their behavior towards Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that they feel insecure about their own sense of mystery and uniqueness compared to the person they are talking to.

Dialogue:
Person1: Look. I'm a little worried about this -- this whole thing with my mother, he admitted to the Professor. I mean, I don't know if I can do it -- I mean, hitting on my own mother, that's pretty heavy.
Person2: Nobody said anything about hitting her! You're just going to take a few liberties with her.
Person1: That's exactly what I said! I mean, a guy and his mother -- that's illegal, isn't it?
Person2: Look, Marty, she's not your mother yet. And if you don't go through with this, she may never be. I know it's hard, but there are some things we must do in life that are unpleasant. Some choices must be made that are difficult. Nonetheless, we must make them. Besides, this may be more than a simple question of your own existence, he added. The fate of the entire space-time continuum may rest on your shoulders . Marty tried to smile at him.
Person1: That's just what I needed to hear.
Person2: It'll be fine, Marty.  You'll be fine. Good luck. He stuck his hand out and Marty shook it. But there was still a question that was nagging at him...
Person1: Professor, if something does go wrong tonight... if I don't get my parents back together... when do you think I'd cease to exist?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern and confusion about the ethical and legal implications of potentially interfering with his own parents' relationship in the context of time travel.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to reassure Marty that he must go through with the difficult task at hand, emphasizing the importance of the situation and the potential consequences of not taking action.

Dialogue:
Person1: DO YOU WANNA DIE?!
Person2: No.
Person1: Yes you do...
Person2: Look, I'm talking about a business deal here.  I buy the ticket for two hundred, take it to a store where the guy behind the counter...  ...doesn't have a death wish  ...I just made myself a quick thirty eight dollars.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing aggression and intimidation towards Person2, while Person2 is trying to divert the conversation towards a business deal involving making a profit from reselling tickets.
Intent_p2: Person2 is explaining a scheme involving buying a ticket for $200 and selling it for a profit of $38, emphasizing that it is a business deal and not related to wanting to die.

Dialogue:
Person1: _Answer_ me.
Person2: We learned he'd found the immigration notaries in Liverpool and traced them to New York.  Then he figured out the birth records in Church Hill...
Intent_p1: Person1 is demanding a response or explanation from Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2 is providing information about someone's investigative process and progress.

Dialogue:
Person1: Boeman don't. You know I'm right.
Person2: Are you crazy?! Pull the lever!
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to prevent Boeman from taking a certain action by asserting their belief that they are correct.
Intent_p2: Person2 is urging Person1 to take action despite their hesitation.

Dialogue:
Person1: I don't work with spooks.  Not after that op in Cambodia.
Person2: I'm authorized to get you out of here.  I thought that's what you wanted.
Person1: What's the job?
Person2: Classic special forces op... hit fast... in and out.  Two men.  Two days.
Person1: Why me?
Person2: We like you.  At least the computer at Langley likes you.  Pulled your file because of various factors.  Service record. Area familiarity.
Person1: Where?
Person2: Not yet.
Person1: I'm not jumping blind.
Intent_p1: Person1 is hesitant to take on a new job due to past experiences and wants more information before committing.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to reassure Person1 that they are authorized to help them leave the current situation and to provide them with information about a potential job involving a special forces operation.

Dialogue:
Person1: I don't like thinking about the accident.  I don't even remember it happening.  Besides, it just makes people feel sorry for me, and...
Person2: You hate that.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing discomfort with thinking about the accident and how it elicits pity from others.
Intent_p2: Person2 is summarizing that Person1 dislikes when people feel sorry for them.

Dialogue:
Person1: She wouldn't get out of the car.  I brought her all the way here, she said she was going to come here, and she wouldn't get out of the car.  But I thought that is was important, that she come to see you, because I know that if you go somewhere and you don't deal with your family stuff, then you're just gonna, she's gonna, um...
Person2: Are you going to England with her Lloyd?
Person1: That's one of the things I wanted to talk to you about sir.
Person2: Are you?
Person1: Am I going?  Am I going to England?  I've thought about this quite a bit, and I've realised what I probably should do is just carve out a goal for my future and find out what I wanna do with my life, do all the stuff that I've been avoiding in a big way. I mean, Diane and I can wait for each other, right?  What's she gonna... she's gonna run off with some English guy?  There's no way.
Person2: Well Lloyd, I admire you for not hitching a ride.  You know, my daughter's a lot different to you.
Person1: I know.
Person2: She's very successful.
Person1: I know
Person2: Very talented.
Person1: I know.  But then I reconsidered.  'Cause I figured out what I really wanna do with my life, what I want to do for a living is I wanna be with your daughter.  I'm good at it.
Person2: You're not a permanent part of her life.  You're a distraction.
Person1: I'm the distraction that's going to England with her sir.  Are you alright sir?  Are you okay?
Person2: I'm incarcerated, Lloyd!  I don't deserve to lose my daughter over this.  I don't deserve to have you as my go-between.  And I can't for the life of me figure out how she could choose to champion in mediocrity the way she flirts around you.
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses his realization that he needs to carve out a goal for his future and confront the things he has been avoiding, including making a decision about his relationship with Diane and his future plans.
Intent_p2: Person2 expresses concern about the relationship between Person1 and his daughter, highlighting that Person1 is seen as a distraction and not a permanent part of her life.

Dialogue:
Person1: You heartless jerk.
Person2: Don't you get it?  They had their 2,000 years.  Now it's our turn.
Person1: So all that bullshit about God and faith.
Person2: It was perfect.  The harder I pushed, the more you pulled away.
Person1: You lied to me my whole life. Everything you said, everything you did.
Person2: Everything I did, I did for you.  I love you, Peter.  Think of it.  I'm giving you a gift, absolute power and knowledge.
Person1: You raised me, like a son.
Person2: You are my son.  Don't you see the opportunity that lies before you?
Person1: You killed my parents.
Person2: I had to.  There was no other way. Their deaths were part of the greatest legacy I could have given you.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing anger and betrayal towards Person2 for lying and manipulating them, especially regarding the death of their parents.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that they believe the actions taken, including killing Person1's parents, were necessary for the greater legacy and opportunity they are providing to Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: You see what I mean?  That reaction would give us away in a second.  Try to relax.
Person2: It's just that... it's been sixteen years since anyone but Harry did that, I--
Person1: Relax.  There, that's better. Let yourself slip into the role.
Intent_p1: Person1 is advising Person2 to relax and immerse themselves in their role to avoid giving themselves away.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern about their ability to convincingly portray a specific behavior due to lack of recent practice.

Dialogue:
Person1: All right, sugar, what's on your mind?
Person2: Don't look at me like that. Auggie. It gives me the creeps.
Person1: Like what?
Person2: Like what you're doing. I'm not going to eat you up.  I need your help, and if you keep staring at me like that. I might start screaming.
Person1: Help, huh? And I don't suppose this help has anything to do with money, does it?
Person2: Don't rush me, okay? You're jumping to conclusions before I've even said anything.  And besides, it's not for me.  It's for our daughter.
Person1: Our daughter? Is that what you said? Our daughter? I mean, you might have a daughter, but I sure as hell don't. And even if I did -- which I don't -- she wouldn't be our daughter.
Person2: Her name is Felicity, and she just turned eighteen.  She ran away from Pittsburgh last year, and now she's living in some shit-hole here in Brooklyn with a guy named Chico. Strung out on crack, four months pregnant.  I can't bear to think about that baby. Our grandchild, Auggie. Just think of it. Our grandchild.
Person1: Stop it, already. Just stop all this crap right now.  Was that your idea to call her Felicity?
Person2: It means "happiness."
Person1: I know what it means. That still don't make it a good name.
Person2: I don't know who else to turn to, Auggie.
Person1: You've suckered me before, darling, remember? Why should I believe you now?
Person2: Why would I lie to you, Auggie? You think it was easy to come here and walk into this place? Why would I do it if I didn't have to?
Person1: That's what you told me when I shoplifted that necklace for you. You remember, baby, don't you? The judge gave me a choice, either go to the can or enlist. So, instead of going to college, I wind up in the navy for four years, I watch men lose their arms and legs, I nearly get my head blown off, and you, sweet Ruby McNutt, you run off and marry that asshole, Bill.
Person2: You didn't write to me for more than a year. What was I supposed to think?
Person1: Yeah, well, I lost my pen. By the time I got a new one, I was clean out of paper.
Person2: It was over with Bill before you ever came home. Maybe you don't remember it now, but you were pretty hot to see me back then.
Person1: You weren't so lukewarm yourself. At least at first.
Person2: It fizzled, baby. That's the way it goes. But we had our times, didn't we? It wasn't all bad.
Person1: A couple of moments, I'll grant you that. A second or two snatched from the jaws of eternity.
Person2: And that's how Felicity came into the picture. During one of those two seconds.
Person1: You're conning me, sweetheart. I ain't responsible for no baby.
Person2: Then why do you think I married Frank? I was already pregnant, and I didn't have much time. Say what you like, but at least he gave my kid a name.
Person1: Good old Frank. And how is fat Mr. Grease Monkey these days?
Person2: Who the hell knows?  He dropped out of sight fifteen years ago.
Person1: Fifteen years ago?  It won't wash, pumpkin. No mother waits fifteen years to tell a man he's a father. I wasn't born yesterday, you know.
Person2: I thought I could handle it. I didn't want to bug you. I thought I could handle it on my own, but I couldn't. She's in real bad, Auggie.
Person1: Nice try, old girl. I'd like to help you out. You know, for old time's sake. But all my spare cash is tied up in a business venture, and I haven't collected my profits yet. Too bad. You caught me at the wrong time.
Person2: You're a cold-hearted bastard, aren't you? How'd you ever get so mean, Auggie?
Person1: I know you think I'm lying to you, but I'm not. Every word I told you is the God's honest truth.
Intent_p1: Person1 is skeptical and hesitant to believe Person2's plea for help regarding their daughter and grandchild, questioning the authenticity of the situation and expressing reluctance to get involved due to past experiences.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to seek help from Person1 for their daughter, who is in a difficult situation, and to emphasize the urgency and seriousness of the matter.

Dialogue:
Person1: Mozart, are you aware I have declared the French play of Figaro unsuitable for our theatre?
Person2: Yes, Sire.
Person1: Yet we hear you are making an opera from it. Is this true?
Person2: Who told you this, Majesty?
Person1: It is not your place to ask questions. Is it true?
Person2: Well, yes, I admit it is.
Person1: Would you tell me why?
Person2: Well, Majesty, it is only a comedy.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2 about creating an opera from the French play of Figaro and seeking an explanation for their decision.
Intent_p2: Person2 is explaining to Person1 that they are turning the French play of Figaro into an opera because it is only a comedy.

Dialogue:
Person1: I had a chat with Liam, and he mentioned the weekend trip you two are planning.
Person2: Oh, that? Thought I mentioned it in passing.
Person1: You never told me that. I had other plans for us this weekend.
Person2: You always assume I'm available. Maybe if you checked in more, we wouldn't have this confusion.
Person1: Communication goes both ways, Henry.
Person2: And maybe you shouldn't rely on third parties to know my plans.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration that Person2 did not communicate about their weekend plans and is highlighting the importance of mutual communication in their relationship.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration with Person1 for assuming their availability without checking in and relying on third parties to know their plans.

Dialogue:
Person1: No, don't be silly. What-what do we need other people for?  You know, we should-we should just turn out the lights, you know, and play hide and seek or something.
Person2: Well, okay. Well, listen, I'm gonna get a cigarette, okay?
Person1: Yeah, grass, right? The illusion that it will make a white woman more like Billie Holiday.
Person2: Well, have you ever made love high?
Person1: Me, no. You... I-I-you know, if I have grass or alcohol or anything I get unbearably wonderful. I get too, too wonderful for words. You know, I don't-I don't know why you have to, uh, get high every time we make love.
Person2: It relaxes me.
Person1: Oh, you-you have to be artificially relaxed before we can go to bed?
Person2: Well, what's the difference, anyway?
Person1: Well, I'll give you a shot of sodium pentothal. You can sleep through it.
Person2: Oh, come on, look who's talking. You've been seeing a psychiatrist for fifteen years.  You should smoke some o' this. You'd be off the couch in no time.
Person1: Oh, come, you don't need that.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing skepticism towards the idea of using substances to enhance experiences and suggests alternative activities like playing hide and seek instead.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting that Person1 should try smoking marijuana to help them relax and potentially improve their mental health.

Dialogue:
Person1: Oh, Judy!! When he had all her money, and the freedom and the power...  he ditched you? What a shame! But he knew he was safe. You couldn't talk. Didn't he give you anything?
Person2: Some money.
Person1: And the necklace. Carlotta's necklace. That was your mistake, Judy. One shouldn't keep souvenirs of a killing. You shouldn't have been that sentimental.
Intent_p1: Person1 is criticizing Judy for keeping a necklace as a souvenir of a killing, implying that it was a mistake due to sentimentality.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Judy made a mistake by keeping a souvenir of a killing, indicating that sentimentality was a weakness in her actions.

Dialogue:
Person1: No, see, Neil, if you're messing with one of my friends, then you're messing with me.
Person2: Don't do that.
Person1: What are you going to do? Hm?
Person2: If you hit me...
Person1: Yeah?
Person2: ... my manager will slap an assault charge on your rear faster than you can say AA, okay?
Person1: Your manager?
Person2: Yeah, man, my manager and my lawyer.
Person1: Well, just, you know, have 'em call me. Y-you know where to find me, right?
Person2: Oh, yeah, drunk on the corner, man. Hey, why don't you buy another beer. It's on me, okay?
Intent_p1: Person1 is asserting their loyalty and protection towards their friend by warning Person2 not to mess with them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is warning Person1 that if they physically harm them, their manager and lawyer will press assault charges against them.

Dialogue:
Person1: There must be some other way out.
Person2: Well, until that's found, I think it's a good idea we all stick together.  Or wouldn't that fit into your plans, baby?
Intent_p1: Person1 is suggesting that they need to find an alternative solution to the current situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting that it would be beneficial for everyone to stay united and work together until an alternative solution is discovered, while also playfully questioning if this suggestion aligns with Person1's intentions.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'll go first.
Person2: No -- I will.
Person1: I stood up first.
Person2: That doesn't matter.
Person1: You always get to go first.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration about not being given the opportunity to go first as they usually do.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting their right to go first in this situation despite Person1's attempt to go first.

Dialogue:
Person1: Mom, please
Person2: You'll have to watch Jamie tonight.
Person1: Not tonight. I've got that date with Brady. You know how important that is.
Person2: Well tonight is very important for your father and me.
Person1: Can't you find somebody else?
Person2: Its too late.
Person1: What am I supposed to tell Brady? Sorry, but I've got to baby-sit my foster sister, go and have fun by yourself.
Person2: Its not exactly the end of the world, for goodness sake
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and disappointment at having to cancel plans with Brady to babysit, and is seeking understanding and a possible solution from Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Person1's date with Brady is not as important as they are making it out to be.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'll drive you, darlin'. You've got no business behind the wheel of an automobile. You don't think about what you're doing and you'll run into a telephone pole.
Person2: I think about what I'm doing all the time, and I've got as much business behind the wheel of an automobile as anybody. Besides, I want you to stay and help Rose with the dishes, the poor girl isn't feeling well.
Person1: All right, darlin'.
Intent_p1: Person1 is offering to drive Person2 because they believe Person2 is not a safe driver and should not be behind the wheel.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting their capability and responsibility to drive while also redirecting Person1's attention to helping someone else.

Dialogue:
Person1: Hold me, Don.
Person2: Don? Where is he?
Person1: HELP HIM!! Promise me you'll help him!
Person2: I promise, Dorothy. I promise.
Person1: Hold me. I'M FALLING!
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a sense of urgency and fear, asking for reassurance and help from Person2 in a critical situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 promises Person1 to help Don and reassures her by promising to do so.

Dialogue:
Person1: Dan!  The spare costumes!  I can't believe you kept them.
Person2: Me neither.  Mine barely even fits.  The thing is, I try to remember why we did it, and I can't.  Helping people, or righting wrongs, or trying to save the world . . . I don't know.  It all seems so abstract.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing surprise and disbelief that Dan kept the spare costumes, indicating a sense of nostalgia and questioning the original purpose behind their actions of helping people, righting wrongs, or trying to save the world.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing uncertainty and doubt about the original purpose or motivation behind their past actions of helping people, righting wrongs, or trying to save the world.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm on the move -
Person2: Your girl works in there ...
Person1: Not my girl anymore
Person2: Yet your still here ... I gave you 24 hours, 24 hours ago ...
Person1: What do you want from me?
Person2: Honestly? I want to - once every few months - get into my car. Pack a lunch. And drive on up to Chino. On visiting day. Bring you some magazines. Maybe some almond clusters. And see you all bright and shiny in your orange jumpsuit. That's what I want ...
Intent_p1: Person1 intends to convey that they have moved on from their previous relationship and are questioning Person2's intentions and desires.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to express a desire to visit Person1 in prison periodically and bring them items to show care and support.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...all train compartments smell vaguely of shit.  It gets so you don't mind it.  That's the worst thing that I can confess.  You know how long it took me to get there? A long time.  When you die you're going to regret the things you don't do.  You think you're queer...? I'm going to tell you something. We're all queer.  You think that you're a thief?  So what?  You get befuddled by a middle-class morality...?  Get shut of it.  Shut it out.  You cheated on your wife...?  You did it, live with it.  You fuck little girls, so be it. There's an absolute morality?  May be.  And then what?  If you think there is, then be that thing.  Bad people go to hell?  I don't think so.  If you think that, act that way.  A hell exists on earth?  Yes. I won't live in it.  That's me. You ever take a dump made you feel you'd just slept for twelve hours...?
Person2: Did I...?
Person1: Yes.
Person2: I don't know.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a philosophy of embracing one's actions and choices without guilt or regret, advocating for living authentically and rejecting societal norms and judgments.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement "I don't know" indicates uncertainty or lack of recollection regarding the experience mentioned by Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: She's got information inside of her.  I need you to get it out.
Person2: No.  No way.  I wouldn't even know where to begin!  Those thoughts about my cousin Elena -- they were just thoughts. I would never --
Person1: C'mon, Rufus, you've been busted twice for felony hacking.
Person2: So?
Person1: So now I need you to hack into her.
Intent_p1: Person1 is pressuring Person2, who has a history of hacking, to extract information from someone by hacking into them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is reluctant and hesitant to hack into someone, expressing discomfort and denial about the idea.

Dialogue:
Person1: And I can't say his name without laughing I want to eat him up. I want to say goodbye to every bad thought I ever had about relationships.  I mean, I crave this guy... and yet... why... why did I have that affair this weekend?  Does that mean I'm not in love with my boyfriend?
Person2: I think you'll know when you see him at the gate.
Person1: It's the death rattle of my singlehood, right? Because I finally see the white picket fence looming and I love it/hate it/love it/hate it/ love it... you're right, I'll know when I see him. Why is it so easy to talk with you?!  Tell me about your fiancee.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing confusion and conflict about their feelings towards their boyfriend and another person, seeking clarity and understanding from Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Person1 will have clarity about their feelings when they are faced with a significant decision or moment.

Dialogue:
Person1: Hey, I've got a great compliment for you.
Person2: You know what? I...
Person1: Just let me talk.  I'm the only one on the face of the earth who realizes that you're the greatest woman on earth. I'm the only one who appreciates how amazing you are in every single thing you do -- in every single thought you have... in how you are with Spencer -- Spence...  ... in how you say what you mean and how you almost always mean something that's all about being straight and good...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their admiration and appreciation for Person2, highlighting their belief that Person2 is exceptional and deserving of recognition.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement is intended to express frustration or annoyance at being interrupted while trying to respond to the compliment given by Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Hey....I was just telling everyone about how I was gonna bring this girl for you but you wouldn't let me do it.
Person2: Hello everyone.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration that Person2 did not allow them to set them up with a girl they were interested in.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement is intended to redirect the conversation away from the previous topic and towards a more general greeting to everyone present.

Dialogue:
Person1: Edie, listen, stay out of this mess. Quit tryin' to ask things about Joey. It ain't safe for you.
Person2: Why worry about me? You're the one who says only look out for yourself.
Person1: Okay, get in hot water. But don't come hollerin' to me when you get burned.
Person2: Why should I come hollering to you at all?
Person1: Because... because...  Listen Edie, don't get sore now but I think we're getting in love with each other.
Person2: I can't let myself fall in love with you.
Person1: That goes double for me.
Intent_p1: Person1 is warning Edie to stay out of the dangerous situation involving Joey and expresses concern for her safety, while also hinting at developing feelings for her.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing reluctance to get involved romantically with Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: You're hitting on me?
Person2: You're a beautiful girl, Elle.
Person1: So everything you just said --
Person2: I'm a man who knows what I want.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2's intentions and expressing skepticism about their compliments.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting their confidence and directness in expressing their attraction towards Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: He hasn't said one word to me.
Person2: Maybe he's just shy.
Person1: My date always pays more attention to you than to me.
Person2: Frida, I don't mean this as a criticism, but you might not want to talk about PMS around men.
Person1: Sorry. It's just so bad lately. You're so lucky you never get PMS.
Person2: I get a little bloated sometimes.
Person1: I'd kill for just a little bloated.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration about feeling ignored by their date and envious of Person2's lack of PMS symptoms.
Intent_p2: Person2 is subtly suggesting that Person1 should avoid discussing PMS around men to prevent potential discomfort or awkwardness.

Dialogue:
Person1: It's all right.  Danny always said I see things with my emotions instead of my eyes.
Person2: It's not your fault, Rafe.  The letter I wrote you, they --
Person1: Don't worry about that.  Guys away from home, lonely, good-hearted women try to cheer them up.
Person2: It's not that I didn't mean everything I wrote.  It's just that -- I thought you were dead.  And now --
Intent_p1: Person1 is reassuring Person2 that they understand the circumstances surrounding the letter and are not holding any grudges.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing regret and explaining that their actions were influenced by believing Person1 was deceased.

Dialogue:

Person2: Ah, Cole.  I don't remember ordering an asshole from room service.
Intent_p1: Person1 wants to have a conversation with Rick.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing annoyance and disdain towards Person1, implying that they do not want to engage in a conversation with them.

Dialogue:
Person1: Do you have a note to corroborate these claims?
Person2: Um, well...
Person1: Are you lying to me?
Person2: Well...
Person1: What did we say about lying?
Person2: I'm not lying.
Person1: You know that no one likes a liar, right?
Person2: I said I'm not lying.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2's honesty and emphasizing the importance of telling the truth.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting that they are not lying despite the questioning and implication from Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: You will not be unaware of the threat now posed by Republicanism.
Person2: Why do you think I keep her here?
Person1: Ah, but therein lies the paradox.  It is her very isolation that encourages the malcontents.  The longer she is away, the stronger they become; and who, honestly, can promise security against that?  However many doors you lock, someone will always get in. Even here.
Intent_p1: Person1 is warning Person2 about the potential danger of Republicanism and how isolating someone can actually fuel dissent and make security measures ineffective.
Intent_p2: Person2 is implying that they are keeping someone isolated to prevent potential threats posed by Republicanism.

Dialogue:
Person1: You set up the line-up.
Person2: Mr. Soze made a few calls, yes. You were not to be released until I came to see you. It seems Mr. Keaton's attorney, Ms. Finneran, was a bit too effective in expediting his release. Holding the rest of you became a moot point.
Person1: What about Redfoot?
Person2: Mr. Redfoot knew nothing. Mr. Soze rarely                 t works with the same people for very long, and they never know who they're working for. One cannot be betrayed if one has no people.
Intent_p1: Person1's intent is to inquire about the fate of Redfoot in the situation being discussed.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Mr. Soze operates in a secretive manner, working with different individuals and ensuring they remain unaware of his true identity to prevent betrayal.

Dialogue:
Person1: I don't got any money... for fixin' me up and all.
Person2: Don't need none.
Person1: Then I better be on my way. Don't wanna put you out no more.
Person2: Think it'd be best if you stayed put while we talk.
Person1: Naw'sir... I gotta be on my way.
Person2: Best try gettin' ya wits about you 'fore you try to...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing reluctance to burden Person2 with their situation and insists on leaving despite being advised to stay for a conversation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting that Person1 should stay put and have a conversation before leaving, indicating concern for their well-being.

Dialogue:
Person1: Jesus! Listen to this one: "Do you remember me? Airport shuttle, June 7th. You: striking redhead with yellow dress, pearl necklace, brown shoes. I was the bookish fellow in the green cardigan who helped you find your contact lens. Am I crazy, or did we have a moment?"
Person2: God, that's so pathetic. I bet she didn't even notice him.
Person1: I know. And he's like psychotically obsessing over every little detail.
Person2: We should call him and pretend to be the redhead.
Person1: Oh, we totally have to.
Intent_p1: Person1 is sharing a message from someone who is obsessing over a brief encounter and seeking validation for a potential connection with a stranger.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to mock the person's obsessive behavior and suggest a prank to further ridicule him.

Dialogue:
Person1: It doesn't matter. Your life is hard enough.
Person2: You're a liar.
Person1: You know I'm not.
Person2: YOU'RE A LIAR!
Person1: Look at me.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to reassure Person2 that their own struggles are insignificant compared to the challenges Person2 is facing.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing disbelief and frustration towards Person1's attempt to downplay the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: I've been asking you for weeks to spend some quality time together.
Person2: I've been swamped with work, Lana.
Person1: If you really cared, you would make time, no matter how busy.
Person2: I do care, but I also need to handle my responsibilities. Let's find a balance.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their frustration about not spending quality time together and emphasizing the importance of making time for each other.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing that they care about spending time together but also need to prioritize their responsibilities and find a balance between work and personal life.

Dialogue:
Person1: You stay out of this, Glinda, or I'll fix you as well!
Person2: Oh, rubbish!  You have no power here. Be gone, before somebody drops a house on you, too.
Person1: Very well -- I'll bide my time -- and as for you, my fine lady, it's true, I can't attend to you here and now as I'd like, but just try to stay out of my way....
Intent_p1: Person1 is issuing a warning to Glinda to stay out of their way and threatening consequences if she interferes.
Intent_p2: Person2 is dismissing Person1's threat by asserting that they have no power and should leave before facing consequences similar to those of the Wicked Witch of the West in "The Wizard of Oz."

Dialogue:
Person1: Calvin, I wish you would have at least let me do the dishes. It's not going to be that easy getting all that dried- on food off my nice plates.
Person2: I just hope those plates aren't radioactive by tomorrow morning.
Person1: Cheese is particularly troublesome.
Person2: Worse than your Kraft Holiday dip?
Person1: Oh, much worse. But not as bad as that Mexican Jumping Bean dip. You remember that?
Person2: Yeah, yeah. Okay.  Give me the roast and watch your step.  I'll come back for the radio.
Intent_p1: Person1 wishes that Person2 had allowed them to do the dishes, expressing concern about the difficulty of cleaning dried-on food from their nice plates.
Intent_p2: Person2 is jokingly implying that the dishes might become radioactive overnight due to the difficulty of cleaning them.

Dialogue:
Person1: No. I will not betray my friends.
Person2: They're not your friends... they've held you back... kept you from your destiny...
Person1: That is not true. They have tried to help me.
Person2: Have they given you what I have given you? Did they even try?
Person1: I... do not want this...
Intent_p1: Person1 is standing firm in their loyalty to their friends despite Person2's attempts to manipulate them into betraying them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to manipulate Person1 by suggesting that their friends are holding them back and that only they can provide what Person1 truly needs.

Dialogue:
Person1: Apart from that, you look pretty chipper for a man who's two thousand and thirty one years old.  I read the clocks. They bear out Hasslein's hypothesis. We've been away from Earth for two thousand years, give or take a decade.  Still can't accept it, huh?
Person2: long pause) You know it.
Person1: Because time has wiped out everyone and everything you cared for -- they're dust.
Person2: Prove it. If we can't get back, it's still just a theory.
Person1: It's a fact, Landon. Buy it. You'll sleep better.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to convince Person2 that they have been away from Earth for two thousand years and that they should accept this fact to find peace.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing skepticism and a refusal to accept the reality that everyone and everything he cared for on Earth has been wiped out by time.

Dialogue:
Person1: I can almost feel your doubt about what I'm saying, Mary.
Person2: I can't give up looking for her, Mrs. Redi, no matter what you're hinting at.
Person1: I have no intention whatsoever of hinting. Your sister, Mary, is a murderess. She killed Irving August -- stabbed him out of fright when he discovered where she was hiding.
Person2: I don't believe it.
Person1: I had to help get rid of the body. You saw it on the subway. And I warn you, Mary -- go back -- you don't know what you're doing, or what dreadful things you might bring about by looking for your sister. You go back to school - - go back and forget Jacqueline.
Intent_p1: Person1 is warning Mary about the dangerous truth regarding her sister's actions and is advising her to stop searching for her sister to avoid potential harm.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to express determination and refusal to give up searching for her sister, despite the shocking revelation and warning given by Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Why did Gregory ask me out? I mean he's cute -- he probably just wants to pitch his screenplay idea.
Person2: Maybe he likes you, ever think of that? It's good for you to go out -- get your mind off Mark.
Person1: You're so lucky you have George and don't need to go on dates anymore.
Person2: What I really hated about dating was the lines guys used to get into my apartment. "Can I use your phone?" "How about a nightcap?" "I want to meet your cat." And my all-time favorite, the old standby, "I have to use your bathroom."
Person1: Maybe they have to pee.
Person2: Are you kidding? He might as well say, "Can I date rape you?"
Person1: I never thought of it like that. I never know what to do on dates. Do guys still pay?
Person2: They better. Of course, trouble is, you never know what they'll expect for it. You gotta know what to order, and what you're willing to do. Like if a guy spends a fortune on you, he's gonna feel like you owe him something.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing skepticism about Gregory's intentions in asking them out and is unsure about dating norms and expectations.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that some men may have ulterior motives when using common lines to gain access to a woman's apartment during dates.

Dialogue:
Person1: Mr. Caiman, you're married.
Person2: And you're beautiful...
Person1: Mr. Caiman...
Person2: Call me Charlie.
Person1: Mr. Caiman, I've been doing extra research for you after hours and weekends for nearly a year. And I've never asked for anything but this job is really important to me. I'm too old to be an assistant anymore. I need to know this job is going someplace.
Person2: So have dinner with me tonight.
Person1: I can't.
Person2: It's your choice.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their dedication to their job and their desire for career advancement.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to offer a personal relationship as a potential advancement opportunity for Person1 in exchange for their dedication and hard work.

Dialogue:
Person1: Forget that stuff, man. I'm not shooting anybody.
Person2: What did I tell you? You don't hafta shoot nobody. Just hold the gun. They'll get the idea.
Person1: I ain't gittin' in that trunk.
Person2: We're only goin' to Koreatown. You'll be in there -- ten minutes.
Person1: Uh-uh. I ain't riding in that trunk no minutes. Why don't I just ride with you?
Person2: You can't ride with me. The surprise effect is ninety percent of it.
Person1: Well, I'm sorry, man, but I ain't gittin' in that trunk.
Person2: I can't believe you do me this way.
Person1: I ain't doin' you no way. I just ain't climbin' in that trunk. I got a problem with small places.
Person2: Well, my ass has got a problem spending ten thousand dollars of my own goddam money to get ungrateful, peanuthead niggas outta jail, but I do it --
Person1: Look, man, I know I owe you --
Person2: Well, if you owe me, git your ass in the trunk.
Person1: I wanna help you, but I don't wanna be locked in the trunk of no car.
Person2: You think I wanted to spend ten thousand dollars on your ass?
Intent_p1: Person1 is refusing to participate in a plan involving holding a gun or riding in the trunk of a car due to personal discomfort and fear of small spaces.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to convince Person1 to participate in a plan by emphasizing that they don't have to shoot anyone, just hold the gun, and that the surprise effect is crucial for the plan's success.

Dialogue:
Person1: Give me that Goddamn thing!  Now get out of here, or I might kill you.  Who knows?
Person2: You've killed women?
Person1: Seventeen of them--eleven by accident.  March!  Move!  You, too!
Intent_p1: Person1 is displaying aggressive and threatening behavior, indicating a history of violence towards women.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning Person1 about their history of killing women.

Dialogue:
Person1: Do you remember the last time we had a quiet drink? I had a milk shake.
Person2: Hmmm... What did we talk about?
Person1: We didn't talk. We never talked.
Person2: And do I detect a rebuke?
Person1: A regret. It was just the two of us, Dad. It was a lonely way to grow up. For you, too. If you had been an ordinary, average father like the other guys' dads, you'd have understood that.
Person2: Actually, I was a wonderful father.
Person1: When?
Intent_p1: Person1's statement implies a sense of longing and disappointment towards their father for not being emotionally present and understanding during their childhood.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies a sense of hurt or disappointment at the accusation made by Person1 about their fathering skills.

Dialogue:
Person1: He's lying.
Person2: Jon, he's hooked up to a full-spectrum polygraph. No one has ever beaten --
Person1: I don't care -- he's manipulating it.  That bomb has been built and it's out there, somewhere.
Person2: What do you expect us to do -- shut down the city, evacuate two million people on a hunch?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a sense of urgency and suspicion that the person being tested on the polygraph is manipulating the results, and believes that immediate action should be taken to prevent a potential threat.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning the practicality and feasibility of taking drastic action based on a suspicion without concrete evidence.

Dialogue:
Person1: I've been thinking of starting my own business. I've done a lot of research and found a niche market.
Person2: Really? You think you can handle it on your own?
Person1: Yes, I believe I have the skills and the drive to make it work.
Person2: Liam, be realistic. You could never do that without me. You need my expertise and connections.
Person1: I appreciate your support in the past, but I want to try this on my own. It's important to me.
Person2: Well, when you realize you're in over your head, you know where to find me.
Intent_p1: Person1 is determined to start their own business and believes they have the necessary skills and motivation to succeed without Person2's help.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing doubt about Person1's ability to succeed without their help and is offering their expertise and connections for support.

Dialogue:
Person1: Excuse me... your voice is familiar and I'm sure I know you from somewhere...
Person2: Awww-rr, Buddy, come on, you know me!
Person1: Well, I... I... ah-h, let's see...
Person2: It's Dave Wilkie! I'm Dave Wilkie, don't you remember me?
Person1: Oh. Oh, God. Of course, Dave, how are you?
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to recall where they know Person2 from and eventually remembers that they know them as Dave Wilkie.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to help Person1 remember their identity by revealing their name as Dave Wilkie.

Dialogue:
Person1: Ugh, I missed the bus again!
Person2: Oh no, do you need a lift?
Person1: No, it's just frustrating. This kind of thing always happens to me.
Person2: Maybe you need a more reliable alarm or to adjust your morning routine.
Person1: It's not just the bus, Evan. It feels like I'm always a step behind in everything.
Person2: We all have rough patches. Let's work together to get you back on track.
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses frustration about consistently missing the bus and feeling like they are always a step behind in everything.
Intent_p2: Person2 is offering support and suggesting practical solutions to help Person1 overcome their feelings of being constantly behind in everything.

Dialogue:
Person1: Poster-Kleiser.
Person2: Oh yeah?
Person1: That's right.
Person2: I'll call you.
Person1: Fine.
Person2: See you later.
Person1: Anyway, you're crazy.
Intent_p1: Person1 is dismissing Person2's behavior as irrational or nonsensical.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing a casual agreement and intention to contact Person1 later.

Dialogue:
Person1: I give ya enough chain so's you can get about the house. Get you to the kitchen. You need the bathroom, it'll reach.
Person2: What do you want?
Person1: We got everything we need. Plenty of food. Ya medicine still got a few good swallows in it...
Person2: WHAT DO YOU WANT FROM ME?!  WHATEVER YOU GONNA DO TO ME, JUST DO IT! AND LET ME GO!
Person1: God saw to it to put you in my path. And I aim to cure ya of your wickedness.
Intent_p1: Person1 intends to confine Person2 in the house, control their movements, and administer medicine to "cure" them of their perceived wickedness.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to express fear and desperation, demanding to know what Person1 wants and urging them to carry out their intentions and release them.

Dialogue:
Person1: No.
Person2: No? Not even one more?
Person1: I never do more than one. I'm sorry.
Person2: I can't talk you into it?
Person1: No. You'll have to get somebody else.
Person2: Now who the hell is going to do that for me?
Person1: I'm sure a substantial number of men in this town would volunteer.
Person2: But I want you to do it, I want somebody who will ask the right questions and everything, somebody I can play to and feel safe because you can't do anything.
Person1: Ouch. Okay, I deserved that. Cynthia, don't you understand? After the first time it's just not spontaneous. There's no edge anymore. Look at the tapes, there is only one date on each label. I have never taped anyone twice.
Person2: So make an exception.
Person1: No.
Person2: How about if you record over the one we already made? You could have the same date and not use another tape. Who would know?
Person1: I would.
Person2: Well, what the hell am I supposed to do?
Person1: Cynthia, I don't know.
Person2: I can't believe you're doing this after I let you tape me.
Person1: I'm sorry. I can't do it.
Person2: Goddamit, give me my tape, then.
Person1: No.
Intent_p1: Person1 is firm in their decision not to make another recording, explaining that they never tape anyone more than once due to losing the spontaneity and edge in subsequent recordings.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to convince Person1 to make an exception and re-record over the tape they made together, but Person1 refuses to do so.

Dialogue:
Person1: I just can't get over the size of that ring.  I just love it.  Fred, look at it.  Tell me you don't love that ring.
Person2: I'm just happy that George has found someone he cares for.
Person1: Yes.  Of course.  But, I'm talking about that ring.  It's something else.  Let me tell you.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing admiration and excitement about the size and beauty of a ring and is eager for validation from Fred.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that they are more focused on the emotional aspect of George's relationship rather than the materialistic value of the ring.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm really struggling with the pressure at work. It's affecting my health.
Person2: Remember when I gave up my job opportunity in New York for you?
Person1: Yes, and I appreciate that.
Person2: Then maybe you should stick it out a bit longer at your job. You owe it to us. You deserve the pressure for making me give up on my dreams.
Person1: That's not fair, Kevin. Our situations were different.
Person2: Life isn’t fair, Elaine. Sometimes we have to make sacrifices.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their struggle with work pressure affecting their health, while Person2 is implying that Person1 should endure the pressure as a form of repayment for sacrifices made by Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2 is implying that Person1 should endure the pressure at work because they made sacrifices for each other in the past.

Dialogue:
Person1: _ Your father raped someone?
Person2: Lisa Sherman was my mother. Do you know who that is?
Person1: Yes.
Person2: I was born nine months after she was raped. One of the four men who raped her is my father. I have no idea which one.
Person1: You're the killed.
Person2: Yes that's the whole point. This is what I was put on this earth to do. Rape the town that raped my mother. Steal its pristine innocence like it stole hers. I've planned this since I was a very little boy. You have no real freedom either. Your father has cast a shadow that you've never eluded.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing shock and disbelief at the revelation of Person2's traumatic family history.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that they believe their purpose in life is to seek revenge on the town that raped their mother by committing similar acts, as they feel their existence is defined by the trauma inflicted upon their mother.

Dialogue:
Person1: And now we come to the architect of this tragic affair, Captain James Tiberius Kirk. I put it to you, Captain, that you were seeking revenge for the death of your son.
Person2: That isn't true...!
Person1: That, either as an instrument of Federation policy or acting on your own drunken initiative, you and your fellow conspirators crippled KRONOS One and cold-bloodedly assassinated the Chancellor of the High Council. Then you and Doctor McCoy went aboard to make certain the job was complete.
Intent_p1: Person1 is accusing Captain Kirk of being the mastermind behind a tragic event involving the assassination of the Chancellor of the High Council.
Intent_p2: Person2 denies the accusation that Captain Kirk sought revenge for his son's death and refutes the claim that he was involved in the assassination of the Chancellor of the High Council.

Dialogue:
Person1: Let's go...
Person2: I just want to sit here longer, I mean the feeling is powerful -- why's that?
Person1: Maybe the best part of your life is over and you don't want to get up and start the bad part.
Intent_p1: Person1 is suggesting that Person2 may be hesitant to leave their current moment because they fear that the best part of their life has passed and they are reluctant to face what comes next.
Intent_p2: Person2 is reflecting on the powerful feeling of the present moment and questioning why that is the case.

Dialogue:
Person1: What do you see as your main strengths?
Person2: I love people. All people. Even people that no one else loves, I think they're OK, you know. Like Beggars.
Person1: Homeless people?
Person2: No, not homeless people. Beggars, Francis Begbie -- one of my mates. I wouldn't say my best mate, I mean, sometimes the boy goes over the score, like one time when we -- me and him -- were having a laugh and all of a sudden he's hit me in the face, right --
Person1: Mr. Murphy, leaving your friend aside, do you see yourself as having any weaknesses?
Person2: No. Well, yes. I have to admit it
Intent_p1: Person1 is asking Person2 about their main strengths and weaknesses.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement suggests that they have a strong sense of empathy and acceptance towards all individuals, even those who may be considered outcasts or disliked by others.

Dialogue:
Person1: The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars, but in ourselves. Well, let me ask you this: what kind of settlement do you seek? What are, for you, the parameters of the possible?
Person2: That's the problem. I can't afford to give her anything.
Person1: Nothing?
Person2: I know that sounds rough but I'm about to close on a deal to develop some mini-malls, and I'm mortgaged up to my ass. If this deal goes south, I'm ruined -- I'll lose millions.
Person1: So, you propose that in spite of demonstrable infidelity on your part, your unoffending wife should be tossed out on her ear?
Person2: Well -- is that possible?
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2's proposal to leave his wife with nothing despite his own financial situation and infidelity.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing their financial constraints and the potential consequences of giving a settlement due to being heavily invested in a deal, leading to uncertainty about the possibility of providing anything to their wife despite their infidelity.

Dialogue:
Person1: Look, don't you wanna show them - Gus, Billy Prince, yourself--that you're not freaked out by the cool kids anymore? That you can go in there, be friends with them, and get your story?
Person2: Yes, desperately.
Person1: Plus, if you quit you're no better than me.
Person2: Better than I...
Person1: That's the spirit!
Intent_p1: Person1 is encouraging Person2 to face their fears, befriend the cool kids, and prove themselves by getting their story, while also implying that quitting would be a step back.
Intent_p2: Person2 expresses a strong desire to prove themselves and gain acceptance from the cool kids by being friends with them and getting their story.

Dialogue:
Person1: Stop it. You are blowing a great opportunity here, Miles. Maya, man. She's great. She's cool. She's funny. She knows wine. What is this gloomy come-down nonsense? These girls want to party. And what was that ten-minute lecture on, what was it, Vouvrays? I mean, come on!
Person2: Let's just say I'm uncomfortable with the whole scenario.
Person1: Oh Jesus, Miles.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and disappointment towards Person2 for not taking advantage of the opportunity with Maya and for being overly serious and critical during the social interaction.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing discomfort and unease with the situation involving Maya and the expectation to party and engage in wine-related discussions.

Dialogue:
Person1: Why did you rearrange the living room without asking me?
Person2: I just thought it'd look better this way. Why does everything have to be a big deal?
Person1: Because it's our shared space. We should make decisions together.
Person2: You are always picking fights. Can't you let something slide for once?
Person1: I just want to be included in decisions, that's all.
Intent_p1: Person1's intent is to express the importance of making decisions together in their shared space.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and asking Person1 to be more flexible and not always pick fights over small changes.

Dialogue:
Person1: Yes, well, I awoke to discover I'd turned into a cat. If you don't do as I say, I'll sink my little fangs into your drumsticks, and suck the marrow straight out of your bones.
Person2: At your service, Count.
Person1: Now give the signal.
Intent_p1: Person1 is asserting their authority and demanding obedience by using their newfound cat form as a threat.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement "At your service, Count." indicates their willingness to comply with Person1's request or command.

Dialogue:

Dialogue:

Dialogue:

Dialogue:

Just as she starts feeling awful, you come up from behind and touch her neck...

Dialogue:
Person1: Professor, we need to talk.

Person1: I think we should consider cutting the experiment short.
Person2: What?
Person1: The force in this house is far greater than I anticipated. In one night I recorded cold spots, shifting magnetic fields, the E.U.P. is picking up white sounds everywhere.

Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to assert authority and control over the situation, emphasizing the importance of continuing the experiment despite the potential danger.

Dialogue:
Person1: Most guys we ran through this either took off or helped them rob the place. I expected you to do the same.
Person2: That shows me already that you don't have a clue. What's it to you, anyway?
Person1: Whether you thought this was for real or not, you jumped in and helped the waitress on instinct. That tells me something about your character.
Person2: Good for you. Now why don't you stop wasting my time and tell me what you want. You didn't go through all this for my benefit.
Person1: It's your lucky day. You just might get the chance to pay back our wonderful country for all the freedom you enjoy.
Person2: A Fed, I shoulda known. Who else would have this kind of budget? Now you're gonna hit me with the sales pitch.
Person1: Alright, Cage, you've got me. This is one of those moments. "Many are called, few are chosen", that kind of thing. Your government needs you. Are you up for the challenge?
Person2: ..If you're trolling around for narcs, man, have you got the wrong guy.
Person1: Why is that?
Person2: Look at me, dude, do I look like a fan of law enforcement? Forget the tests, you shoulda just asked me. I woulda saved you a lot of trouble.
Person1: Oh I don't know, I think the tests work pretty well. Sometimes they give me answers you wouldn't admit to in a million years.
Person2: Are we done now? You've got nothing on me. So if you ain't booking me, I'm walking.
Person1: You've got this wrong. You're not under arrest, you've been abducted. And until I say different, you belong to me.
Person2: Is that a fact?
Person1: Sure as gravity. I've had a feeling about you from the start, Cage. It's nausea.
Person2: You know what I hate? Any scumbag with a clean shirt and a bad haircut can get one of those tin stars and suddenly they think they're God.
Person1: You know what I hate? It's always the assholes that pass the tests.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to recruit Person2 for a government mission, acknowledging Person2's character based on their actions and challenging them to step up for their country.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies a disdain for law enforcement and a frustration with individuals who abuse their authority.

Dialogue:

Dialogue:

Dialogue:

For example, on the self-abuse front -- now this is important - it's not advisable to do it in the shower -- it wastes water and electricity and because we all expect you to be doing it there in any case -- and, um, not onto the linen, and not on your sister's underwear or any clothing belonging to your mother --

Dialogue:

Dialogue:
Person1: It's loaded with what?
Person2: Tomatoes.
Person1: Ha! Who told you about the Stardust Ballroom?
Person2: Thomas. He told me it was a very nice place.
Person1: Oh, Thomas. Ma, it's just a big dance hall, and that's all it is. I been there a hundred times. Loaded with tomatoes. Boy, you're funny, Ma.
Person2: Marty, I don't want you hang arounna house tonight. I want you to go take a shave and go out and dance.
Person1: Ma, when are you gonna give up? You gotta bachelor on your hands. I ain't never gonna get married.
Person2: You gonna get married.
Person1: Sooner or later, there comes a point in a man's life when he gotta face some facts, and one fact I gotta face is that whatever it is that women like, I ain't got it. I chased enough girls in my life. I went to enough dances. I got hurt enough. I don't wanna get hurt no more. I just called a girl just now, and I got a real brush-off, boy. I figured I was past the point of being hurt, but that hurt. Some stupid woman who I didn't even wanna call up. She gave me the brush. I don't wanna go to the Stardust Ballroom because all that ever happened to me there was girls made me feel like I was a bug. I got feelings, you know. I had enough pain. No, thank you.
Person2: Marty...
Person1: Ma, I'm gonna stay home and watch Jackie Gleason.
Person2: You gonna die without a son.
Person1: So I'll die without a son.
Person2: Put on your blue suit...
Person1: Blue suit, gray suit, I'm still a fat man. A fat ugly man.
Person2: You not ugly.
Person1: I'm ugly... I'm ugly! I'm UGLY!
Person2: Marty...
Person1: Ma! Leave me alone!
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses his reluctance to go out and socialize due to past experiences of rejection and hurt, feeling that he is not attractive enough to find love and preferring to stay home and avoid further pain.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to encourage Marty to go out, socialize, and potentially find a partner despite Marty's negative self-perception and past experiences with rejection.

Dialogue:

Person1: Answer affirmatively. Simply. Keep those answers to three words. You weren't 'part of a group,' you were her anesthesiologist. Isn't that right?
Person2: Yes.
Person1: You were there to help Dr. Marx deliver her baby. Were you not?
Person2: Yes.

Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to confirm their role as the anesthesiologist present during the delivery to help Dr. Marx deliver the baby.

Dialogue:

Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern about Andy's questionable social circle.

Dialogue:

Intent_p2: Person2 is implying that Brad does not want to see Person1 because he dislikes them.

Dialogue:

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm thinking of reporting the irregularities I've noticed in the accounts.
Person2: Before you do anything rash, remember, I know a lot about you. It might not be in your best interest to stir the pot.
Person1: Are you threatening me?
Person2: Just reminding you that everyone has secrets. Think carefully about your next move.
Intent_p1: Person1 is considering reporting irregularities in the accounts but is being warned by Person2 to be cautious due to potential consequences related to their own secrets.
Intent_p2: Person2 is cautioning Person1 to reconsider reporting the irregularities by subtly implying that they have information that could potentially harm Person1 if revealed.

Dialogue:
Person1: You let me make a fool of myself! You lied to me! I dont know why that surprises me because lying is what you do. Its your job. Its who you are. How would you even know if something were real?
Person2: Youre judging me?! Oh, thats a good one. Youre lying to me, youre lying to your family, and youre lying to yourself. But youre going to stand there and point a finger at me? The man you hired to pretend to be your boyfriend?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and betrayal towards Person2 for lying and pretending to be their boyfriend, questioning their ability to discern truth from lies.
Intent_p2: Person2 is pointing out the hypocrisy of Person1 for judging them for lying when Person1 themselves hired them to pretend to be their boyfriend.

Dialogue:
Person1: Who's this person?
Person2: He's a friend. from the neighborhood. we were just talking.
Person1: From the neighborhood?  Shut up.  You like telephones? Huh? You wanta go for a ride?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing suspicion and questioning the credibility of Person2's explanation about the acquaintance, while also abruptly changing the subject to potentially distract or intimidate Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that the person in question is a friend from the neighborhood with whom they were having a conversation.

Dialogue:
Person1: You researched me.  You know where I live.  She'll be waiting for you there along with your split.
Person2: There's two police cars now.
Person1: Tailgate me.  I'll jam on the brakes.  You go into a spin to avoid an accident and cut them off.
Person2: You want us to get ourselves killed?
Person1: From what I can see you're a pretty fair wheelman.  There's a hairpin coming up -- that's the place for it. The cops'll plow right into you.
Person2: And I end up in a neck brace for life!
Person1: Then you can sue the cops. Collect from both ends.  Tighten your belts.  Here it comes.  Ready?
Intent_p1: Person1 is instructing Person2 to tailgate them, jam on the brakes, and cut off the police cars chasing them in order to cause an accident and escape, suggesting they can sue the cops for compensation if they get injured.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern about the dangerous plan proposed by Person1 and questioning the potential consequences of getting involved in a risky car chase with the police.

Dialogue:

Person2: My parents baby-sitter canceled.
Person1: So?
Person2: So I have to watch Jamie tonight.

Person2: This morning.
Person1: Well you found out this morning? Why didn't you tell me before? I mean it's 5 o'clock now Rachel...shit
Person2: Don't get angry.
Person1: I'm not angry it's just
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration that Person2 did not inform them earlier about having to watch Jamie that night due to the baby-sitter canceling.
Intent_p2: Person2 is explaining to Person1 that they have to watch Jamie tonight because their parents' babysitter canceled, and Person1 is expressing frustration about not being informed earlier.

Dialogue:
Person1: Gino Marzzone is coming to your apartment.  It's a big deal, isn't it?  That means Caesar will be ready. He doesn't want to look like an idiot. Gino has been there before?
Person2: Yeah, twice.
Person1: What happened?
Person2: Not much, really.  Caesar was nervous, kept cleaning the apartment.  |The first time, he picked out the dress he wanted me to wear.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern about Caesar's anxiety and desire to impress Gino Marzzone when he visits their apartment, referencing past instances where Caesar was nervous and particular about details.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Caesar was anxious and particular about the details when Gino Marzzone visited their apartment, even going as far as choosing an outfit for Person2 to wear during one of the visits.

Dialogue:
Person1: Security, uh Norm, Norm speaking.
Person2: Norman? This is Mr. Eddie Vedder, from Accounting. I just had a power surge here at home that wiped out a file I was working on. Listen, I'm in big trouble, do you know anything about computers?
Person1: Uhhmmm... uh gee, uh...
Person2: Right, well my BLT drive on my computer just went AWOL, and I've got this big project due tomorrow for Mr. Kawasaki, and if I don't get it in, he's gonna ask me to commit Hari Kari...
Person1: Uhhh.. ahahaha...
Person2: Yeah, well, you know these Japanese management techniques.  Could you, uh, read me the number on the modem?
Person1: Uhhhmm...
Person2: It's a little boxy thing, Norm, with switches on it... lets my computer talk to the one there...
Person1: 212-555-4240.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to assist Person2 with their computer issue by providing the modem number.
Intent_p2: Person2 is seeking technical assistance with computer issues and is asking Person1 to read the number on the modem to troubleshoot the problem.

Dialogue:
Person1: Cut that shit out.
Person2: She smiled baby.
Person1: That's not cool.
Person2: Did she, or did she not smile?
Person1: It doesn't matter...
Person2: I'm telling you, they love that shit.
Person1: You're gonna screw up our plan.
Person2: We're gonna get laid, baby.
Person1: First let's see what happens if we play it cool.
Person2: What? You think she's gonna tell her pit-boss on us?
Person1: Don't make fun, I think we can get some complimentary items if we don't fool around.
Person2: Who's around? I'm not making fun. Let's do it, baby.
Person1: The trick is to look like you don't need it, then they give you shit for free.
Person2: Well, you look money, baby. We both look money.
Intent_p1: Person1 is cautioning Person2 against engaging in inappropriate behavior and suggests playing it cool to potentially receive complimentary items.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to encourage Person1 to act confidently and attract attention in order to receive complimentary items.

Dialogue:

Intent_p1: Person1 is suggesting to Person2 that they should have a quick intimate moment despite the presence of Person1's father, as they need to focus on their own relationship and not worry about others.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern about the inappropriate nature of engaging in a sexual encounter while Person1's father is nearby.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...no....I don't....I don't remember you. Who's this?
Person2: That's not true. That's not true at all. You said that your name was Georgia and you said our conversation was confidential and I trusted you and you kept calling and asking me for money, c'mon now I want to talk to your owner, your supervisor, whoever runs this, you understand. Please connect me now.
