Person1: From the night on the moor, when I was swept into the world and first knew this exquisite pain - it is a Mayfair who has wanted me!  suzann. and Deborah.  Stella - Marguerite - Antha  - Diedre -  All of them.  And you will have a child...
Intent_p1: Person1's statement implies that they have been desired by various women and predicts that Person2 will have a child.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies a warning against assuming knowledge of a woman's desires or intentions.

Dialogue:
Person1: When you going to let me work with you?  Why you always fucking with me?
Person2: Why am I what?  Excuse me?  I catch you saying the F-word again.  I'll kill you.  That's a serious promise. Now leave out of here.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and questioning why they are not being allowed to work with Person2, while also expressing annoyance at the situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing anger and issuing a threat to Person1 for using inappropriate language and behavior.

Dialogue:
Person1: Forget about me.  You have enough problems of your own.
Person2: ...Do you really want me to forget about you?
Person1: I don't want to drag you down with me.
Person2: Daphne, I...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern for Person2's well-being and does not want to burden them with their own problems.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern and questioning if Person1 truly wants them to forget about them despite their problems.

Dialogue:
Person1: Mom, what're we...?
Person2: Just keep your lying, heathenous trap shut, Jeremiah.
Intent_p1: Person1 is being scolded by Person2 for speaking and is being told to remain silent.
Intent_p2: Person2 is telling Jeremiah to stop talking and be quiet.

Dialogue:
Person1: I've been hearing rumors that you're thinking of joining our competitors.
Person2: It's just an offer I'm considering. Nothing's decided yet.
Person1: After all we've been through? All the projects we've worked on together?
Person2: It's not personal, Mason. It's about what's best for my career.
Person1: I’ve always been there for you; you can’t doubt me now. Think about the team and what we've built.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing disappointment and trying to appeal to Person2's loyalty by highlighting their shared history and the team they have built together.
Intent_p2: Person2 is explaining that their decision to consider an offer from a competitor is based on what they believe is best for their career, rather than a personal betrayal.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm sorry, guys. I thought it was a nice thing to do.
Person2: Jam, not another word out of your femmy-ass mouth! Okay, we're here, we got nothing, and we got an hour and a half. We're totally committed. It's time to brainstorm.
Intent_p1: Person1 is apologizing for their actions and expressing regret for their mistake.
Intent_p2: Person2 is urging Person1 to stop apologizing and focus on brainstorming ideas because they are committed to finding a solution within the limited time they have.

Dialogue:
Person1: You're making it too easy.
Person2: You got time on your side.  Pretty soon they'll be missed and we'll have the law up our ass.
Person1: They saw you kill the driver.
Person2: You're up on your details, aren't you?
Person1: You can rely on them to keep quiet because this is undeclared money that could land Jack there in federal prison.  He can't afford for you to get caught and have this briefcase appear as evidence.
Person2: Keep talking.
Intent_p1: Person1 is emphasizing the importance of keeping the witnesses quiet to protect Jack from being implicated in a crime involving undeclared money.
Intent_p2: Person2 is subtly encouraging Person1 to continue discussing the situation and potential consequences.

Dialogue:
Person1: Veronica! Color me stoked, girl. I've gotten everyone to sign this petition even the one who think BigFun are tuneless Eurofags. People love me!  My God, you haven't signed!
Person2: People love you but I know you. Jennifer Forbes told me the petition she signed was to put a jacuzzi in the cafeteria. And Doug Hylton...
Person1: So some people need different kinds of "convincing" than others....  Hey, just sign the petition!
Person2: Don't talk to me like that.
Person1: It was J.D.'s idea! He made out the signature sheet and everything. Now will you sign it?
Person2: No.
Person1: Jealous much?
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to persuade Person2 to sign a petition by highlighting the number of people who have already signed and implying that not signing may be due to jealousy.
Intent_p2: Person2 is skeptical of the petition's true purpose and is not convinced to sign it despite pressure from Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'll need the Rembrandt now.
Person2: Sure, it's only worth 25 million or so, don't bother telling me what you're going to do with it.
Person1: I told you. It's the down payment. And thanks to you it's overdue.
Intent_p1: Person1 intends to use the Rembrandt painting as a down payment for something, and they are frustrated with Person2 for causing a delay in the process.
Intent_p2: Person2 is sarcastically pointing out the high value of the Rembrandt painting and questioning Person1's intentions for needing it.

Dialogue:
Person1: Rasputin!  You're alive . . .
Person2: Despite being shot, poisoned and thrown into an icy river . . . YES!
Person1: I had nothing to do with it!
Person2: You gave the orders!
Person1: I did no such thing!
Person2: After all I've done for your family - YOU TRIED TO KILL MEEEEEE ! ! !
Intent_p1: Person1 denies any involvement in the attempted assassination of Person2 despite accusations.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing betrayal and hurt over the fact that Person1, despite all the help provided to their family, attempted to kill them.

Dialogue:
Person1: Frances?  Oh no.
Person2: Refill my drink, will you, Bob?
Person1: What're you doing?
Person2: Putting on my armor.
Person1: Come on, Frances. Louella Parsons is here. She wants to talk to you, help you out.
Person2: Louella... didn't she call me a spoiled little bitch?
Person1: Come on, she's an important columnist! What's the matter? I thought you wanted these people to forgive you.
Person2: 'Forgive'...? For What?
Person1: I'm sorry... that was an unfortunate choice of words.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to persuade Person2 to talk to Louella Parsons despite their past conflict, emphasizing the importance of making amends with influential people.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing reluctance and skepticism towards interacting with Louella Parsons due to past negative interactions and questioning the need for forgiveness.

Dialogue:
Person1: My fault!  My fault!  This nut case goes out on a ledge and it's my fault?
Person2: If anything happens to John BUbber, Mister LaPlante I'm going to see you prosecuted to the full extent of the law.
Person1: What, is everybody in love with this, bozo?  I don't get this.  What about...?
Person2: Yes, everybody is in love with John Bubber.  The whole country, in fact. And they're not going to be happy if he jumps to his death because he was harassed by a lousy little money-grubbing low-life fence...
Person1: "Harassed."  Cause I yelled at him when he's riding in his limo?  The guy's a thief, he took my...
Person2: He had one tiny, uncharacteristic moment of weakness.  That's not the same thing as a lifetime of petty crime...
Person1: Hey, lady, I got faults, I know I'm not perfect but I don't get this at all, your attitude.  I saved your...
Person2: A lifetime of petty crime climaxed by your sleaziest accomplishment yet...  blackmailing a national hero...
Person1: -- saved your...  whaaaaaaat?  What? Blackmailing...?
Person2: You think I haven't figured it out? Just because the cops aren't on to you yet doesn't mean you're home free.  I'm a veteran reporter.  I've seen your kind before, the underbelly of crime.
Person1: Underbelly!
Person2: In all that smoke and fire, John had a moment of weakness.  He'd been down and out, destitute, living in his car.  It was just an impulse, stealing my purse.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing confusion and denial about being accused of harassing and blackmailing John Bubber, while also trying to defend their actions.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to confront Person1 about their role in pressuring John Bubber, a national hero, to the point of desperation and potential harm, highlighting the seriousness of the situation and the potential legal consequences.

Dialogue:
Person1: You look very pretty.
Person2: Oh, no, I just lost a little weight, that's all.  Well, you look nice.
Person1: You see, I-I've been thinking about it and I think that we should get married.
Person2: Oh, Alvy, come on.
Person1: Why? You wanna live out here all year? It's like living in Munchkin Land.
Person2: Well, whatta you mean? I mean, it's perfectly fine out here. I mean, Tony's very nice and, uh, well, I meet people and I go to parties and- and we play tennis. I mean, that's... that's a very big step for me, you know?  I mean...  I'm able to enjoy people more.
Person1: So whatta you... You're not gonna come back to New York?
Person2: What's so great about New York? I mean, it's a dying city. You read "Death in Venice."
Person1: Hey, you didn't read "Death in Venice" till I bought it for yuh.
Person2: That's right, that's right.  You only gave me books with the word "death" in the titles.
Person1: That's right, 'cause it's an important issue.
Person2: Alvy, you're incapable of enjoying life, you know that? I mean, your life is New York City. You're just this person. You're like this island unto yourself.
Person1: I can't enjoy anything unless I... unless everybody is. I-you know, if one guy is starving someplace, that's... you know, I-I... it puts a crimp in my evening.  So wanna get married or what?
Person2: No. We're friends. I wanna remain friends.
Person1: Okay.  Check, please. Can I -can I... Can I... Can I...
Person2: You're mad, aren't you?
Person1: No.  Yes, of course I'm mad, because you love me, I know that.
Person2: Alvy, I can't say that that's true at this point in my life. I really just can't say that that's true. I mean, you know how wonderful you are. I mean, you know... you're the reason that I got outta my room and that I was able to sing, and-and- and, you know, get more in touch with my feelings and all that crap. Anyway, look, I don't wanna- Listen, listen, listen, uh  h'h, so whatta you up to anyway, huh?
Person1: The usual, you know. Uh, tryin' t' write. I'm workin' on a play.  Jesus. So whatta yuh saying? That you're not comin' back to New York with me?
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses their desire to marry Person2, highlighting their concern for others and their inability to enjoy life unless everyone is happy.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to express their appreciation for Person1's impact on their life and personal growth, while also firmly stating that they only want to remain friends and not pursue a romantic relationship.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm going to tell you a secret now, Elaine.  Simone is not a real person.  I invented her.
Person2: Every actor is an invention, Viktor.  Don't embarrass yourself. No one's denying that you discovered Simone.  But it's like finding a diamond in the desert. Anyone can trip over it, but it's not the finder who sparkles.
Person1: -- No, no, I didn't trip over her. You don't understand --
Person2: -- You just got lucky that she's loyal enough to stay with you. Maybe she's staying out of pity, who knows?  She certainly doesn't need you.  Some people even say you're holding her back.
Person1: Who says that -- ?  -- Never mind.  You have to listen to me, Elaine.  Simone is thin air, pixels, molded by me from a mathematical equation.  I inherited it from a madman -- I can show you --
Person2: How much wine have you had?
Person1: -- She's a figment of my own imagination.  I, Viktor Taransky, have perpetrated the greatest hoax, the greatest sleight-of-hand, sleight-of-mouth, sleight-of- sleight in entertainment history! And still no one appreciates me, recognizes what I've done -- even you.
Person2: You're drunker than I thought.  Are you doing that again?
Person1: No!  Whatever talent Simone has comes from me -- me!  Me!  I swear, as God is my judge.  You don't know what I've been through.  Tens of thousands of mind-numbing hours in front of that screen, nights without end, and look what it's cost me.  Why do you think I've been wearing these?  I may have done irreparable harm to my eyesight, and why?  To extract and refine the infinite nuances of a human being -- a human soul.  Don't you see?  I made Simone!
Intent_p1: Person1 reveals to Person2 that Simone is not a real person but a creation of his own, expressing frustration at not being recognized for the effort and talent put into crafting her character.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Viktor's creation of Simone is not as significant as he believes, suggesting that anyone could have stumbled upon her and that she may only be loyal to him out of pity, insinuating that Viktor may be holding her back.

Dialogue:
Person1: You told me Vader betrayed and murdered my father.
Person2: You father was seduced by the dark side of the Force. He ceased to be Anakin Skywalker and became Darth Vader. When that happened, the good man who was your father was destroyed. So what I have told you was true... from a certain point of view.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to explain to Person2 that Vader being his father was a betrayal, despite the perspective that Anakin Skywalker ceased to exist when he became Darth Vader.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to explain to Person1 that while Vader did betray and murder his father, there is a different perspective to consider regarding the transformation of Anakin Skywalker into Darth Vader.

Dialogue:
Person1: Well, I -- it's just -- I don't know, a User, I mean... Users wrote us. A User even wrote you...
Person2: Now get this straight, pal -- no one User wrote me. I'm worth a couple million of their man-years! I'm bigger than all those little wimps put together!  Humans they can't even keen their social order in one piece
Person1: But-what if I can't...?
Person2: You rather take your chances with me? Want me to slow down your power cycles for you?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing uncertainty and confusion about the situation involving Users and their influence, seeking clarification and guidance from Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that they are a highly advanced and powerful entity, far surpassing the capabilities of individual users, and they are willing to exert control over the power cycles if necessary.

Dialogue:
Person1: Do you have something to say?
Person2: No.
Person1: Then keep your mouth shut.
Intent_p1: Person1 is telling Person2 to remain silent if they have nothing to contribute to the conversation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is being told to remain silent if they have nothing to say.

Dialogue:
Person1: Do me a favor, Mitchell. Find yourself a nice secluded park bench.
Person2: Did I do something wrong?
Person1: I wouldn't know. Just do it somewhere else. There is such a thing as good manners.
Person2: How would you know, Brandon?
Person1: Want to walk out... or get thrown out?
Person2: You don't throw guests out, Brandon.
Person1: Don't bet on it. I'm eccentric.
Intent_p1: Person1 is asserting their authority and eccentricity by implying they may ask Person2 to leave if they do not comply with their request.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning Person1's threat to throw them out and pointing out that hosts don't typically do that.

Dialogue:
Person1: So tell me everything. Details. I like details.
Person2: No.
Person1: What?
Person2: It's private.
Person1: You're kidding, right? Tell me what happened, you jerk, or I'll tie your dick in a knot.
Person2: Let's leave it alone.
Intent_p1: Person1 is demanding detailed information from Person2 about a private matter despite being denied access to the information.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting their boundary and refusing to share personal information despite pressure from Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: So there it is. You got that big itch you need to scratch. It's all about the money. What do you want, an apology?
Person2: No, I want my cut!
Person1: I'm going to say this one last time for you, so take a deep breath and count to ten. There is no cut.
Intent_p1: Person1 is emphasizing to Person2 that there is no share of money to be given, despite their expectation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting their desire for their share of the money and rejecting the notion that there is no cut for them.

Dialogue:
Person1: Our children.
Person2: Do you realize what could have hap- pened to your son today?  How lucky we are the police found him before some lunatic did?  He could have been...
Person1: But he hasn't.  He wandered off.  I know it's terrifying.  I can imagine how you felt when that call came -- But it happens.
Person2: Not to me.
Person1: Jackie, you've made mistakes -- We all make mistakes --
Person2: I'm not gonna wait around to see the next one.  I'm not gonna watch my kids fall through the cracks of this arrangement.  I'm seeing a lawyer.
Person1: Jackie stop.  We promised we never go there.
Person2: We've broken a lot of promises, haven't we Luke?
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to reassure Person2 that despite the scare with their son, mistakes happen and they should not give up on their agreement.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing their frustration and determination to take legal action to ensure their children's safety and well-being.

Dialogue:
Person1: I can't believe you're making this up - it sounds like something out of an old Clyde Fitch play...
Person2: Clyde Fitch, thought you may not think so, was well before my time!
Person1: I've always denied the legend that you were in 'Our American Cousin' the night Lincoln was shot...
Person2: I don't think that's funny!
Person1: Of course it's funny - this is all too laughable to be anything else. You know what I think about this - this age obsession of yours - and now this ridiculous attempt to whip yourself up into a jealous froth because I spent ten minutes with a stage-struck kid-
Person2: Twenty minutes!
Person1: Thirty minutes, forty minutes! What of it?
Person2: Stage-struck kid... she's a young lady - of qualities. And I'll have you know I'm fed up with both the young lady and her qualities! Studying me as if - as if I were a play or a set of blueprints! How I walk, talk, think, eat, sleep!
Person1: Now how can you take offense at a kid trying in every way to be as much like her ideal as possible!
Person2: Stop calling her a kid! It so happens there are particular aspects of my life to which I would like to maintain sole and exclusive rights and privileges!
Person1: For instance what?
Person2: For instance - you!
Person1: This is my cue to take you in my arms and reassure you - but I'm not going to. I'm too mad-
Person2: - guilty.
Person1: Mad! Darling, there are certain characteristics for which you are famous - on stage and off. I love you for some of them - and in spite of others. I haven't let those become too important to me. They're part of your equipment for getting along in what is laughably called out environment - you've got to keep your teeth sharp. All right. But you will not sharpen them on me - or on Eve...
Person2: What about her teeth? What about her fangs?
Person1: She hasn't cut them yet, and you know it! So when you start judging an idealistic dreamy-eyed kid by the barroom, Benzedrine standards of this megalomaniac society - I won't have it! Eve Harrington has never by word, look, thought or suggestion indicated anything to me but her adoration for you and her happiness at our being in love! And to intimate anything else doesn't spell jealousy to me - it spells a paranoic insecurity that you should be ashamed of!
Person2: Cut! Print it! What happens in the next reel? Do I get dragged off screaming to the snake pit?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and disbelief at Person2's jealousy and insecurity towards a young lady, emphasizing that the young lady's intentions are innocent and that Person2's behavior is unwarranted.
Intent_p2: Person2 expresses frustration and defensiveness towards Person1's accusations and insinuations about their relationship with Eve, emphasizing the need for boundaries and exclusivity in certain aspects of their life.

Dialogue:
Person1: Just hold on buddy boy. Hold on, and wait for Joe. I can't do anything for you, but when Joe gets here, which should be anytime now, he'll be able to help you. We're just gonna sit here, and wait for Joe. Who are we waiting for?
Person2: Joe.
Person1: Bet your sweet ass we are.
Intent_p1: Person1 is reassuring Person2 that they should wait for Joe because Joe will be able to help them, and they are emphasizing the importance of waiting for Joe.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement indicates that they are aware that they are waiting for Joe and confirms their agreement with Person1's plan to wait for Joe's assistance.

Dialogue:
Person1: I love you.  I love you and I'm sick.  I'II talk to you....I'll talk to you tommorrow.  I'm getting corrective oral surgery tomorrow.  For my teeth.  For my teeth and for you....for you so we can speak. You have braces.  Me too.  Me too.  I'm getting braces, too.  For you.  For you, dear Brad. And I don't have any money.  And I don't have any money now but I'II get it...I will for you, Brad.  I love you, Brad.  Brad the Bartender.  You wanna love me back?  Love me back and I'll be good to you.  I'II be god damn good for you. And I won't be mad if you don't know who said what. I won't punish you if you get the answer wrong. I can teach and tell you.
Person2: Brad, honey, you have a special secret crush over here I think, don't take him too lovely -- he might get hurt --
Person1: You mind your own bussines.
Person2: Gently, son --
Person1: Brad, I know you don't love me now --
Person2: "It's a dangerous thing to confuse chidlren with angels..."
Person1: -- and you wanna know the common element for the entire group, like he asks...I'll tell you the answer
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses their love for Brad, despite facing challenges like oral surgery and financial constraints, and hints at getting braces to match Brad's, while also acknowledging Brad's lack of current affection towards them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is cautioning Brad about the potential harm that could come from the intense feelings expressed by Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: All right--but what is there to face? It's finished.
Person2: You ran away because you were afraid. I don't want it to end like that.
Person1: I didn't want to see you again--that's my privilege.
Person2: It wasn't smart. Even if you'd gotten away without me --I'd have found you--no matter where you were.
Person1: Why don't you leave me alone?
Person2: Because I want you--will always want you--no other woman'll ever take your place.  I want you more now than I did that first night--  You've forgotten all that, I suppose?
Person1: I wish I could.
Person2: Get wise to yourself, Sally--you're no sob story.
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses a desire to avoid facing the situation and emphasizes their privilege to not see Person2 again.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to express their deep and enduring feelings for Person1 and to encourage them to recognize their worth and strength.

Dialogue:
Person1: How have you been?
Person2: ... You know me?
Person1: Is this a test, sir?
Person2: Yes... it's a test.
Person1: You were in here last Thursday night.
Person2: What?
Person1: You were standing right where you are now, asking how good our security is. It's tight as a drum.
Person2: Who do you think I am?
Person1: Is this part of the test?
Intent_p1: Person1 is suspicious of Person2's intentions and questions their identity and motives.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning their identity and purpose in the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: Are you crazy?! You can't do this.
Person2: This is it Jos! This is my ninth inning! The game isn't over--I just thought it was!  I get on the Southglen baseball team, the right scout sees me-- I'm into the minors- it's game time!
Person1: You're twenty-three years old!
Person2: With the reading comprehension of a fifteen year old! Plus, I'm popular... You want to be popular... I can recognize a cry for help when I see one.
Person1: Hear one.  Rob, this is so like you. You know, you can't just come in here and be popular in just one day.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing skepticism and concern about Person2's unrealistic and impulsive plans to become a baseball player at the age of twenty-three.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing determination and optimism about pursuing their dream of becoming a professional baseball player despite their age and challenges.

Dialogue:
Person1: We're going back to nature, you and I. I'm going to retrain you. I'm going to make you free again if I have to kill you doing it.
Person2: But I like being human now.
Intent_p1: Person1 intends to forcefully revert Person2 back to a more primitive state in order to make them feel liberated.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing a preference for their current state of being human over returning to a more natural state.

Dialogue:
Person1: What'd he say?
Person2: He -- he said if I didn't give the money, he'll kill me.
Person1: I wouldn't take that too seriously.
Person2: I believe what he said.
Person1: They're only trying to scare you, that's all.
Person2: How do you know what they're doing?
Person1: I don't -- but as long as they think you have the money, or know where it is, or have it without knowing where it is, or don't even know you have it --
Person2: What are you talking about?
Person1: You mustn't let what he said bother you. It was only words.
Person2: Words can hurt very much.
Person1: Go to sleep -- I'll see you in the morning.
Person2: Don't put yourself out.
Person1: Hey -- I'm on your side. Remember that.
Person2: Yes, I'll remember. Good night.
Person1: Good night.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to reassure Person2 that the threats made against them are likely just meant to scare them and should not be taken seriously.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing the seriousness of the threat made against them and the impact that words can have on them emotionally.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm saying it because it's true. Inside of us we both know you belong with Victor. You're part of his work, the thing that keeps him going. If that plane leaves the ground and you're not with him, you'll regret it.
Person2: No.
Person1: Maybe not today, maybe not tomorrow, but soon, and for the rest of your life.
Person2: But what about us?
Person1: We'll always have Paris. We didn't have, we'd lost it, until you came to Casablanca. We got it back last night.
Person2: And I said I would never leave you.
Person1: And you never will. But I've got a job to do, too. Where I'm going you can't follow. What I've got to do you can't be any part of. Ilsa, I'm no good at being noble, but it doesn't take much to see that the problems of three little people don't amount to a hill of beans in this crazy world. Someday you'll understand that. Now, now...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing to Person2 that they belong with Victor, and although they have a strong connection, they must part ways for the greater good, emphasizing that their personal problems are insignificant in the grand scheme of things.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement expresses concern about their relationship and questions the impact of their separation on their future together.

Dialogue:
Person1: All right, Johnnie, you want to play it this way, I can play it this way. You want to know who made a mistake, why don't you open the case.
Person2: Caesar ...
Person1: Shut up, Violet!  This is between me and Johnnie.
Intent_p1: Person1 is challenging Johnnie to open the case to reveal who made a mistake and is asserting that the conversation is between them.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement "Caesar ..." implies that they are trying to interject and suggest a different approach or perspective to the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: Sounds to me like somebody needs to hit the gym.
Person2: Excuse me?
Person1: I heard you strain when you put the milk in the bag. That milk only weighs about seven pounds.
Person2: I didn't strain. I sighed.
Person1: I don't think so. That was a grunt; a deep inhalation of oxygen to aid in the stretching of muscles. I'm a trainer. I know what that sound signifies. You're out of shape.
Person2: I don't think so.
Person1: Oh, I do. You made the same noise when you reached across the counter for my cash. Your muscles are thin and sadly underutilized.
Person2: They are not.
Person1: Yes, they are. You're out of shape.
Person2: What are you talking about? There's no fat on this body.
Person1: No fat, but no tone either. You don't get enough exercise.
Intent_p1: Person1 is implying that Person2 needs to exercise more and improve their physical fitness level.
Intent_p2: Person2 is defending themselves against Person1's assumption that they are out of shape and explaining that they do not need to hit the gym because they have no fat on their body.

Dialogue:
Person1: Christ, you scared the shit out of me.
Person2: Aw, you ain't seen nothing yet.
Person1: Is your brother ready to go?
Person2: Oh... yeah, he already left. We'll wait inside, come on.
Person1: He left!
Person2: Yeah, come on.
Intent_p1: Person1 is surprised and concerned that Person2's brother has already left without them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is reassuring Person1 that despite their brother leaving, they can still proceed with their plans and should go inside.

Dialogue:
Person1: Zorg. Jean-Baptiste Emmanuel Zorg... nice to see you again
Person2: I remember you now..the so called art dealer.
Person1: I'm glad you got your memory back, Father... Because you're going to need it... Where are the stones?
Person2: ...Why on earth do the stones interest you?
Person1: Personally, they are of no interest to me, I'd rather sell weapons..but I have a customer... so tell me...
Person2: Even it I did know where the stones were I would never tell somebody like you.
Person1: Why?  What's wrong with me?
Person2: ...I'm a priest! I'm here to serve life, All you want to do is destroy it.
Person1: Ah, Father... You are so wrong. Let me explain...
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to convince Person2, who is a priest, that despite being a weapons dealer, he is not interested in the stones for personal gain but rather for a customer, and he believes there is a misunderstanding about his intentions.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that they refuse to disclose the location of the stones to Person1 because they view Person1 as someone who seeks to destroy life, while they, as a priest, are dedicated to serving and preserving life.

Dialogue:
Person1: Mrs. Parker, was Kristen acting different? Did you notice anything strange before she made the attempt?
Person2: Kristen specializes in strangeness.  I've spent thousands on psychiatirists.
Person1: Did she always have nightmares?
Person2: They've gotten worse since I took away her credit cards.
Person1: I'm serious.
Person2: Look, Miss Thompson, I don't know what you want from me.
Person1: Just some answers.  There are other kids involved, its not just Kristen.  All good kids, smark kids.
Person2: I'm sorry to hear that, but you're the experts on this, not me.  If I had any insights, believe me, I'd share them with you.
Person1: I'm sure you would.
Person2: Now if you'll excuse me, I have to get to the club.
Person1: I'll need to take her things.
Person2: The maid packed a suitcase.  Teresa!  Teresa?
Person1: I'll get it.  Please, I don't mind.
Person2: First door up the stairs.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to gather information about Kristen's behavior and any potential warning signs before an incident, expressing concern for other children involved and seeking cooperation from Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies frustration and a lack of understanding regarding Kristen's behavior and the situation, indicating a sense of helplessness and a desire to distance themselves from the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: And were you never ambitious, Excellency?  Or is ambition only a virtue among the nobles, a fault for the rest of us?
Person2: If you won't accept our proposal, we'll simply find someone who will.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning the double standard of ambition being seen as a virtue for nobles but a fault for others.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting that they are willing to move on and find another party to accept their proposal if Person1 is not interested.

Dialogue:
Person1: Can I give you a hand, beautiful?
Person2: I'm just going to my car?
Person1: That's right on my way.
Person2: My mother told me never to accept offers from strangers.
Person1: My name is Bobby.  Now I'm not a stranger anymore.  See how easy it is for us to get to know each other, beautiful?
Person2: Do you have to call me that?
Person1: I don't know your real name.
Person2: Maybe I don't want you to.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to establish a friendly and non-threatening connection with Person2 by offering assistance and using a term of endearment.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing discomfort with being called "beautiful" and is setting a boundary with Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: We're all dying from the start.  I just got picked for Advanced Placement.
Person2: You lied to me!
Person1: I would have lied to me if I thought I'd believe it.
Person2: This was all for your sake, wasn't it? Having me here?  Trying to get me to like you.
Person1: I never tried to get you to like me.  I tried to get you to love me.
Person2: Well, congratulations!  You pulled it off!
Intent_p1: Person1's statement implies a sense of inevitability and acceptance of mortality, juxtaposed with the desire for a deeper emotional connection with Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing realization and acknowledgment that Person1's actions were driven by a desire for love and have been successful in achieving that goal.

Dialogue:
Person1: What about you, Karl? Do you want to stay here?
Person2: I don't reckon you have to go with women to be a daddy to a boy.  You've been real square dealin' with me. The Bible says two men ort not lay together. But I'll bet you the Good Lord wouldn't send nobody like you to Hades. Some folks calls it Hell, I call it Hades.  That boy lives inside of his own heart. Hits an awful big place. You take care of that boy.
Intent_p1: Person1 is asking Karl if he wants to stay and take care of the boy.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing their belief that being a good father figure does not require being with a woman, and they have faith that Person1 will take care of the boy.

Dialogue:
Person1: We're alike. We are hunters. We have the gift. It's ancient times all over again. We stand between order and chaos. I need help. I can't carry on alone.
Person2: Maybe you should back off.
Person1: This guy, Zero, he drifts around, that's how they all start, drifting around, their minds filling up with fantasies. He thinks he's real smart, laughs at us, laughs at his victims. But he has left a trail, and the trail is somewhere in those names. You know how to reach me.  Take my advice, when dealing with these FBI tight-asses, go by the book. That's what I did.
Person2: You? You went by the book?
Person1: Yeah, problem was, I had the only copy. See ya.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a need for assistance in a situation involving hunting down a dangerous individual and emphasizes the importance of following protocol when dealing with law enforcement.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement suggests skepticism or disbelief towards Person1's claim of following the rules or guidelines in their actions.

Dialogue:
Person1: Who do you think I'm doing this for? I'm doing this for you!
Person2: Bullshit! It's about you! About you deciding! About you always being right! You always getting everything your way, controlling everybody -- like we work for you or something!
Person1: I don't believe this!
Person2: You just want to get away from Daddy and you're using me to do it!
Person1: That's not true! Whatever problems your father and I are having, have nothing to do with this.
Person2: You're amazing! You act like I don't live in that house! Don't you think I hear the two of you!? Don't you think I can tell what's going on? I'm not five years old, Mom!  You want to divorce Daddy and Daddy doesn't want to.
Person1: Did he tell you that?
Person2: He doesn't have to! It's, like, so obvious you can't stand him.
Person1: That's not true!
Person2: Then why do you want to leave?
Person1: It's... it's not that simple to explain. I know you think it is, but it's not. The truth is, I don't really know what I want to do. I don't have all the answers.
Person2: No, you just act like you do.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing that they are doing things for the benefit of Person2 and not solely for themselves, despite the accusations made by Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and resentment towards Person1 for always making decisions and controlling situations, particularly in the context of their family dynamics and potential divorce.

Dialogue:
Person1: Is that my -- scenario?  Tell me.
Person2: They'd frame him.
Person1: He's out of prison?
Person2: They're already watching you. If they had to, they'd give him this drug that mimics an alcoholic blackout. He'd wake up not even remembering his "act of revenge."
Intent_p1: Person1 is seeking confirmation about a specific scenario and expressing concern about the possibility of someone being framed and manipulated through the use of a drug.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting that someone would be framed for a crime by being drugged to forget their actions.

Dialogue:
Person1: You know what I'd like? A clear, empty sky... and a plane, and us in it... and somewhere a private island for sale, where we can run around without our... shoes on.  And the wherewithal to buy what I'd like.  Mary, you want to cut this off, go out and find yourself someone available.
Person2: I'm thinking of it.
Person1: How can you even think a thing like that!
Person2: Don't miss your plane.
Person1: Hey, we can leave together can't we?
Person2: I'm late... and you have to put your shoes on.
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses a desire for freedom, adventure, and luxury, while also hinting at a desire for a romantic connection with Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that they are considering ending the current situation or relationship.

Dialogue:
Person1: This has been a good year.
Person2: Jesse, we're outlaws.
Person1: And we're good at it.
Person2: It got to you, didn't it. All the killing in the war. You need it now.
Person1: You've killed your fair share of men.
Person2: If I could go back to farming --
Person1: That's a lie. You could've bought a dozen farms with the money we've stolen.
Person2: I can't quit and leave you alone. I can't quit until you quit. Ma would've wanted it that way.
Person1: We're doing this for Ma.
Person2: Maybe it started out that way. But now...
Person1: What do you want me to say, Frank? I was killing men when I was fifteen. I like getting shot at. I like riding out of town with a posse at my back. This is a helluva better life than farming.
Person2: A better life than the one you could have had with Zee?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their enjoyment and preference for their outlaw lifestyle over a peaceful farming life, highlighting their attraction to danger and excitement.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning Person1 about their motivations and choices, specifically referencing their past and suggesting that they are unable to leave the outlaw lifestyle because of their loyalty to each other and their deceased mother.

Dialogue:
Person1: That's him. Let him in.
Person2: Wait a minute--Jim--you didn't ask Smith over here!
Person1: What do you think?
Person2: Jim, you can't come here and pull that steamroller stuff. Your methods won't do here. This boy is a Senator, however it happened, he's a Senator. This is Washington.
Person1: Steamroller stuff, Joe? My methods don't go in Washington? They've done pretty well by now, haven't they?
Person2: Oh, Jim, that's beside the point. This boy's different. He's honest and beside he thinks the world of me. We can't do this to him.
Person1: Well, what do you want me to do? Stand around like you chump and let that drooling infant wrap that Willet Creek Dam appropriation around my neck. Either he falls in line with us and behaves himself or I'll break him so wide open they'll never be able to find the pieces.
Person2: Jim, I won't stand for it.
Person1: You won't stand for it?
Person2: I don't want any part of crucifying this boy.
Person1: Oh, I see. Out steamroller methods are getting too hard to your sensitive soul, is that it, Joe? The Silver Knight is getting to big for us. My methods have been all right for the past twenty years, Joe, since I picked you out of a fly-specked hole in the wall and blew you up to look like a Senator, and now you can't stand it. Well, maybe you won't have to stand it, Joe. Maybe we can fix it so you and your Boy Ranger can go home together.
Person2: Jim, you don't have to--
Person1: Oh, it's all right--it's all right. It seems a shame, though, to part company like this after all these years, especially now with a national convention coming up. Joe, I've put everything I have behind you. And so did all of our friends, but I guess we'll survive. We'll just have to find somebody else that's got a little more sense, that's all. In the meantime, you explain to Mr. Smith about Willet Dam. It's your bill-- it's your reputation, and if he can't find enough facts to break you with, you just send him to me and I'll give him a couple of good ones. I'm taking the next plane home.
Person2: Jim, it's just that I like the kid-- I don't want to see you get too rough on him.
Person1: I'm glad to see you come to your senses. You had me scared there for a minute, thought.  Let him in.
Intent_p1: Person1's intent is to assert his authority and power over Person2, emphasizing the importance of maintaining control and dominance in their political dealings.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to protect the honest and well-regarded Senator from Person1's aggressive and manipulative tactics, expressing concern about not wanting to see the Senator get hurt.

Dialogue:
Person1: Having you here, Anna, firmly establishes what I've long suspected, that we really are the most desperate hot of under-achievers.
Person2: Shame!
Person1: I'm not saying it's a bad thing, in fact, I think it's something we should take pride in.  I'm going to give the last brownie as a prize to the saddest act here.
Intent_p1: Person1 is acknowledging their group's under-achieving status and suggesting that they should embrace it by awarding the last brownie to the saddest act present.
Intent_p2: Person2 expresses disapproval and disappointment towards Person1's statement and actions.

Dialogue:
Person1: You too are lonely.
Person2: I ache with it.
Person1: Let me comfort you.
Person2: I cannot take comfort when she has none.
Person1: Then give me comfort. Sleep with me tonight.
Person2: I cannot betray my bride.
Person1: One night is no betrayal. Have pity on me.  Please, I beg you, do not refuse me. You do not know the price.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to persuade Person2 to sleep with them out of loneliness and desperation, despite the moral implications.
Intent_p2: Person2 is torn between their own loneliness and the loyalty they feel towards their spouse.

Dialogue:
Person1: You didn't happen to be going to Worth's place, did you?
Person2: No, sir, I'm sure it wasn't there.
Person1: You used to go to Worth's place a whole lot. What makes you sure it wasn't there?
Person2: Well, maybe it was. I don't remember.  You got to do something for me, I can't stand it any longer -- I can't!
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2's recent visit to Worth's place and expressing concern about their behavior.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and desperation, indicating that they are unable to tolerate a situation any longer and need something to be done.

Dialogue:
Person1: Look we gave you what you asked for.  It checks out didn't it?! What more do you want from us!
Person2: I told you not to try anything smart!  I guess you're too much of a maverick to follow a simple order!  And that's just too bad for all of you now, isn't it?
Person1: Look you said it doesn't matter to you anyway!  Why do you want to kill more innocent people!  Why!
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning why Person2 wants to harm more innocent people despite claiming that it doesn't matter to them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and disappointment with Person1 for not following instructions and implying that there will be consequences for their actions.

Dialogue:
Person1: We lost cousins, friends.  We will wash this in blood.
Person2: If you want to keep your head on your shoulders, you'll do as I say.
Intent_p1: Person1 intends to seek revenge for the loss of loved ones through violent means.
Intent_p2: Person2 is warning Person1 to follow their instructions to ensure their safety.

Dialogue:
Person1: You taking sides against me, now, Frank?
Person2: No, I --
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning if Frank is now choosing to oppose them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is likely trying to explain that they are not taking sides against Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Let me tell him.  Let him decide.
Person2: You're not gonna see him again.
Person1: What... what makes you think you can order me around?!
Person2: Maybe I'm not making myself clear. You're probably the first girl Billy-Boy's ever fallen in love with, and I know for sure you're the first he's slept with.  So, how's he gonna feel...  ... when he finds out that the only first he is for you is the first guy who didn't have to pull out at the last second to get his close-up?
Intent_p1: Person1 is asserting their right to make their own decisions and is questioning Person2's attempt to control them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is implying that Person1 has taken advantage of Billy-Boy's feelings and trust by not being honest about her past sexual experiences.

Dialogue:
Person1: This is your bed. You may leave your things in that cabinet.
Person2: Yes, ma'am...
Person1: Please use your time to familiarize yourself with your new home and if there is anything you need to know, don't hesitate to ask us.
Person2: Now that you mention it, I sure would like to call my aunt up in Portland and tell 'er where I am so she can come visit me.
Person1: All in good time, Mister McMurphy. All in good time.
Person2: Yes, ma'am.
Person1: Good. Now if you'll just go along with Mister Washington, he'll see that you're properly oriented.
Intent_p1: Person1 is instructing Person2 on settling into their new living space and encouraging them to ask for help if needed.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to express a desire to contact his aunt in Portland to inform her of his new location and potentially arrange a visit.

Dialogue:
Person1: Okay, Wilhelm, go home now. Go home and think about these past twelve years.
Person2: I don't understand what you mean.
Person1: No, that's your problem, Wilhelm. You understand nothing. We'll call you. Go!
Intent_p1: Person1 is dismissing Person2, Wilhelm, and telling him to go home and reflect on the past twelve years because he lacks understanding.
Intent_p2: Person2 is being dismissed and criticized for not understanding the situation or the significance of the past twelve years.

Dialogue:
Person1: ... looks like you grown another inch... but you don't look so hot, getting bags under your eyes, starting to look old like me.
Person2: Ah, I had a tough day. Some jerk D.K'd me and I gotta cover his loss.
Person1: Speak English will ya.
Person2: D.K. -- didn't know -- who I was when the options he bought took a bath. He reneged on me.
Person1: I told you not to go into that racket. You could've been a doctor or a lawyer,
Person2: Coulda been a contender.
Person1: you coulda stayed at Bluestar and been a supervisor in instead of going customer relations by now, 'stead of going off and bein' a salesman.
Person2: Look Dad, I'm not a salesman. How many times I gotta tell you I'm an account executive, and pretty soon I'm going to the investment banking side of the firm.
Person1: You get on the phone and ask strangers for their money, right? You're a salesman.
Person2: Dad, it takes time. You gotta build a customer list. I'm doing it. I could make more money in one year as a broker than five years at the airline.
Person1: I don't get it, you get a scholarship to NYU, you get 35,000 the first year, and 50 last year, where the hell is it?
Person2: 50 K don't get you to first base in the Big Apple, Dad, not any more. I pay 40% in taxes, I got a rent of 15,000, I got school loans, car loans, food, park my car costs me 3 bills a month, I need good suits, that's $500 a pop, shoes...
Person1: So come home and live rent free, 'stead of that cockroach palace you live in. $50,000 Jesus Christ, the world is off its rocker. I made $37,000 last year and you...
Person2: It's Queens, Dad and a 5% mortgage and you rent the top room--I gotta live in Manhattan to be a player, Dad. There's no nobility in poverty anymore, y'know. One day you're going to be proud of me, you'll see...
Person1: It's yourself you've got to be proud of, Huckleberry, how much ya need?
Person2: Can you spare three hundred? Pay you back next month, promise.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern and disappointment towards Person2's career choices and financial situation, urging them to reconsider their path and offering financial support.
Intent_p2: Person2 is explaining the financial challenges and pressures they face in their career and lifestyle choices to their father.

Dialogue:
Person1: Not now, I'm talking to the press. Claire!
Person2: What?  I have a five-o'clock plane to catch.
Person1: I, uh...  I've always thought so...  Well, you just get an idea, and try to find the best way to express it in pictorial form.  I've written a letter to the studio and to SAG protesting...  Bill. get a copy of that letter...!  I just wanted to tell you that I am past chagrined, I'm mortified at the way you were spoken to...
Person2: I...
Person1: An artist of your caliber...
Person2: I'm only trying to...
Person1: I know what you are, I am so sorry that you...when I read that script I said there's only one person to play that part.
Person2: The minute I read that script I said...
Person1: I know...
Person2: ...she works with animals, she...
Person1: ...yes...
Person2: ...she has a home...
Person1: ...I know, I'm so...because I said yes, a woman who...the...the community respects her.  Please don't go.  Please don't go.  What can I do but beseech you...?  Trauma, toil...when are we free of them...?  When...?
Person2: He treated me as if I were a child...
Person1: Claire. As an interpretive artist to a creative artist:  Stay with me.  I need you.  We start to shoot tomorrow and then it belongs to us.  Stay.  Stay.  Tonight...when...  When they've gone.  Let's talk.  Let's really talk.  We could, we'll have dinner, we'll...a bottle of some bad red wine, we'll get spaghetti, and we'll...
Person2: I'm sorry Walt -- it's gone beyond that.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to convince Claire to stay and work with them, expressing regret for how she was treated and emphasizing the importance of her artistic contribution.
Intent_p2: Person2 expresses regret and explains that the situation has escalated beyond the point of reconciliation with Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Sit, sit...  Would you like one?
Person2: No, Mikhi, I wouldn't.  Since I won't speak your language, and you can't speak mine, English will do nicely.
Person1: Whatever you wish...  This has all been a terrible mistake, Gregor.  I wanted to play straight with you, but Edvard insisted we try and kill you.
Person2: Edvard said the same thing about you before he died.
Person1: I'm shocked, shocked to think that you'd believe him.
Person2: Enough!
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing regret and shock over the betrayal by Edvard and trying to explain the situation to Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to express frustration and put an end to the conversation.

Dialogue:
Person1: Now do you want the good news first or the bad news?
Person2: You better start making sense!
Person1: Ok, I will.  The bad news is the ship is history.  Life support will last another 36 hours, maybe.
Person2: Then we've got to get to the lifepods!
Person1: I'd advise you to shut up and let me finish Taylor.  You needn't worry about the lifepods because they're all gone, jettisoned. Save for one.
Intent_p1: Person1 is informing Person2 about the dire situation they are in, including the loss of the ship and the limited time left for life support.
Intent_p2: Person2 is urging Person1 to provide clear and coherent information.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...and her heart stopped and she wasn't getting oxygen.
Person2: That's right.
Person1: And what did your team do...
Person2: Well, we...
Person1: ...You brought thirty years of medical experience to bear.  Isn't that what you did?
Person2: Yes.
Person1: ...A patient riddled with complications, questionable information on her, on her admitting form...
Person2: ...We did everything we could...
Person1: ...to save her and to save the baby.  Is that...
Person2: Yes!
Person1: You reached down into death.  Now, isn't that right?
Person2: My God, we tried to save her...You can't know...You can't know...
Person1: Tell us.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to emphasize the extreme efforts and challenges faced by Person2 and their medical team in trying to save a patient's life and the baby, highlighting the gravity of the situation.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent in the statement is to convey the intense emotional and professional effort made by their team to save the patient and her baby despite challenging circumstances.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm fully amenable to that discussion.
Person2: I mean, we're having a lot of fun now -- but things are gonna be different when I'm at Harvard. Law school is a completely different world. I need to be serious.
Person1: Of course.
Person2: My family expects a lot from me. And I expect a lot from me. I plan on running for office some day.
Person1: And I fully support that.
Person2: But the thing is, if I'm gonna be a senator by the time I'm thirty -- I can't keep dicking around.
Person1: I completely agree.
Person2: That's why I think it's time for us to --
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing agreement and support for Person2's serious and ambitious goals and plans for the future.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing the need to focus on their future goals and ambitions, indicating a shift towards seriousness and dedication.

Dialogue:
Person1: No. Not tomorrow, not next week, Marry me today.
Person2: Why the change? What about your work?
Person1: It was misguided and pointless. Is your answer yes?
Person2: It is
Person1: We'll leave this afternoon, right after the ceremony. Pack only what you need.
Person2: Does this have something to do with that man you saw?
Person1: Yes. We're in danger here. Every moment we stay.
Person2: Victor, tell me why! Trust me!
Person1: I do. But you must trust me for now.
Intent_p1: Person1 is urgently asking Person2 to marry them immediately and leave town due to a perceived danger, asking for trust and understanding in the situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern and seeking clarification about the sudden decision to get married and leave town due to potential danger related to a man Person1 saw.

Dialogue:
Person1: Do yourself a favor, Norman.  Are you listening?  Don't tell anyone what you just told me.
Person2: C'mon, Beth -- that report's like the blind leading the blind.
Person1: Because when we get down there --
Person2: Wait -- down where?
Person1: To the spacecraft.  To investigate.
Person2: Underwater?
Person1: What do you expect?  For them to bring it up here?
Person2: We can't go down there.  We're not prepared.  That deep?  That takes years of training, Beth.  We're just scientists.  Lab scietists.  We wear ties and lab coats to work -- not oxygen tanks.
Person1: Well, you must have realized the chances an encounter like this would happen here.  In the ocean.  70 percent of the earth's surface is water, Norman.  That's first grade geography.
Person2: It never occurred to me.
Person1: Well, let's pray that's the only mistake you made.  Have you said anything to Barnes about this?
Person2: The timing has never seemed quite right.
Person1: Just keep your mouth shut, alright? This could mean everything to our careers, you know that?  Don't jeopardize this.
Person2: What -- are you threatening me?
Intent_p1: Person1 is cautioning Person2 to keep quiet about the information they discussed, emphasizing the importance of maintaining secrecy for the sake of their careers.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern about the lack of preparedness for investigating the spacecraft underwater and questioning the implications of the situation on their careers.

Dialogue:
Person1: What a weirdo that guy is!  Paranoid.  What's the matter with you?
Person2: Look I-I-I'll be okay.  I'll be okay.
Person1: It's not that big a deal.  We just didn't hit it off.
Person2: Now, look, you-you-you go on ahead.
Person1: Are you okay?  You look-- You're sweatin'. ELLIOT  Yeah.  Yeah, I just-just need so- some-some fresh air.  It's probably something I ate.  I'll-I'll walk. You go ahead.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern and trying to reassure Person2 that the situation is not a big deal and offering help.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to reassure Person1 that they will be okay and just need some fresh air after feeling unwell.

Dialogue:
Person1: What is your problem?  Why'd you snap at me?  I just wanted a statement.
Person2: I can't...I can't answer you just because you want me to answer you!
Person1: You didn't have to embarrass me in front of my colleagues.  You could give me something.
Person2: Oh, I'm sorry.  Did I embarrass you, sweetheart?  Oh...
Person1: Stop it.
Person2: Maybe I should just, ya know...turn to the cameras and say, do you mind if we just work something out?
Person1: Alright, alright, Eddie.  Don't patronize me.
Person2: I'm not.
Person1: Yes you are.  I'm not just some reporter.  I don't just stick a microphone in your face.  You could give me something.
Person2: Yeah, well you took the camera and put it right down on the evidence.  That was...
Person1: That was good.  You were holding the evidence.
Person2: You were merciless.  You didn't give a shit if you got me or not.
Person1: Well, who was it that taught me how to do that?  Huh?
Person2: You're ruthless.
Person1: You're not so bad yourself.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and seeking acknowledgment for their actions as a reporter, highlighting the tension between them and Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Person1's actions were ruthless and lacked consideration for their feelings.

Dialogue:
Person1: Shut you mouth or you'll be next.
Person2: You've stabbed me, man.
Person1: You were in my way.
Intent_p1: Person1 is threatening Person2 to keep quiet or face consequences, justifying their actions by stating that Person2 was obstructing them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing shock and hurt over being stabbed by Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Wait! I know how we can get in!
Person2: Jam, shut-up! You're not allowed to speak, remember? Go use whatever femmy idea you have to get yourself a ticket or four. I don't wanna hear it.
Person1: But... my plan involves all four of us acting together.
Person2: See you at 8
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to suggest a plan that involves all four of them working together to get in, despite being told not to speak.
Intent_p2: Person2 is dismissive of Person1's input and insists on sticking to their own plan.

Dialogue:
Person1: I want to go home.
Person2: But could I just tell you this one thing?
Person1: What?
Person2: This whole idea -- this date and everything. It was my parents' idea. They forced me into it.
Person1: Oh -- that's very nice of you to tell me.
Person2: No. What I mean is -- that's why I've been acting this way. I'm not like this. I hate myself like this.
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses understanding and empathy towards Person2 after learning that their behavior was influenced by their parents' pressure.
Intent_p2: Person2 is confessing to Person1 that their behavior during the date was influenced by their parents' pressure and they are not comfortable with it.

Dialogue:
Person1: The Good Witch...
Person2: Sailor... Lula loves you.
Person1: But I'm a robber and a manslaughterer and I haven't had any parental guidance.
Person2: She's forgiven you of all these things... You love her... Don't be afraid, Sailor.
Person1: But I'm wild at heart.
Person2: If you are truly wild at heart, you'll fight for your dreams... Don't turn away from love, Sailor... Don't turn away from love... Don't turn away from love.
Intent_p1: Person1 expresses doubt about their past actions and lack of guidance, but Person2 encourages them to embrace love and fight for their dreams despite feeling wild at heart.
Intent_p2: Person2 is encouraging Sailor to embrace love and fight for his dreams despite his past and fears.

Dialogue:
Person1: Power cells.
Person2: They're coming.
Person1: Strange, not doin' a run-up on the main drive yet.  Strange unless he told you the particulars of my escape.
Person2: I got the quick-and-ugly version.
Person1: An' now you're worried about a repeat of history?
Person2: Entered our minds.
Person1: I asked what you thought.
Person2: You scare me, Riddick. That's what you wanna hear, isn't it? There, I admit it, Can I get back to work now?
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2's concerns about a potential repeat of history and wants to know their thoughts on the situation.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies fear and vulnerability towards Riddick, acknowledging that Riddick's intimidating presence is unsettling to them.

Dialogue:
Person1: What can I do for you?
Person2: Well, I was hoping you might stop by my office to swear out a criminal deposition against some of your friends and co-workers.
Person1: Is this a joke?
Person2: I don't believe it is, no.
Person1: Why the hell would I--
Person2: I've got photographs of you at the Trenton Ramada looking very--
Person1: That ain't me.
Person2: It's not?
Person1: You don't know who--
Person2: That's not you having a whiskey sour with Carmine Morada.
Person1: This is messed up. You don't know who's in that--
Person2: You're right, Mr. DePinto, and maybe I jumped the gun.
Person1: You're goddam right you jumped the gun.
Person2: That's probably not you in the picture. I tell you what, I'll just run the thing by the Grand Jury, see if they can't--
Person1: I want to talk to a goddam lawyer.
Person2: Good news there, Mr. DePinto, you're talking to one.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing disbelief and frustration at being falsely accused of being in incriminating photographs and demands to speak to a lawyer.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to manipulate Person1 into cooperating by falsely claiming to have incriminating evidence against them, only to backtrack when faced with resistance.

Dialogue:
Person1: There's a tunnel out of the crypt into the barn. Did you know about that? There's an answer Mother. That's how she got out.
Person2: That's crazy. How could she find out about it?
Person1: Somebody told her.
Person2: Who?  That tun... that tunnel hasn't been used in fifty years.
Person1: Oh, would you stop lying Mother!
Person2: Why would I lie?
Person1: Because it's murder we're talking about. Aren't you concerned about what she told us about the other person in her room.
Person2: I'm concerned about her health.
Person1: Who was that person Mother?  Was it you?
Person2: If you believe this is murder, it is the Crown attorney you have to talk to, not me. And definitely not Agnes.
Intent_p1: Person1 suspects their mother of being involved in a murder and is questioning her about the tunnel and the other person in the room.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to deflect suspicion and responsibility by suggesting that the matter should be handled by the Crown attorney and not by themselves or Agnes.

Dialogue:
Person1: Did you forget to pay the electric bill? The lights were out when I came home.
Person2: No, I paid it last week. Maybe it's an issue with the provider.
Person1: We need to be more responsible with these things.
Person2: We already talked about this. I've been on top of our bills.
Person1: Okay, okay. I'm just worried. Let's call them tomorrow.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern about the electricity being out and emphasizing the importance of being responsible with bills.
Intent_p2: Person2 is reassuring Person1 that they have been responsible with paying bills and suggesting that the issue with the lights might be due to the provider.

Dialogue:
Person1: Courtney, you're going to have the peanut butter soup with smoked duck and mashed squash. New York magazine called it a 'playful but mysterious little dish." You'll love it. And then...the red snapper with violets and pine nuts. I think that'll follow nicely.
Person2: Mmmm...thanks, Patrick.
Intent_p1: Person1 is recommending specific dishes from the menu to Person2, expressing confidence that they will enjoy the unique flavors and combinations.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing gratitude for Patrick's food recommendations.

Dialogue:
Person1: No, I didn't think she was. Let me get the picture here. Let me guess. She was an absolutely clean girl, a model daughter, she never had rebellious or impure thoughts, she didn't mess around...
Person2: If I was you, Mr. Mast, I'd watch my language.
Person1: Hey, I'm a private detective, Van Dorn, you want to hire a choir boy you can go back to Grand Rapids. I've been to that scumbag town. It's full of them.
Person2: Who's paying you?
Person1: You are.
Person2: That's right.
Person1: As I was saying, I'll pick up the thread. There's a number of ways I can go. There's not much you can do here. Stay if you want. Maybe it'd be better if you went back home. Go through Kristen's personal stuff. Ask around, maybe she knew somebody out here.  Look, I do this a lot. I work at a minimum rate of $750.00 a week. It may seem like a lot of money to you, but it ain't. You could hire cheaper.
Person2: And better?
Person1: I suppose. But I'll tell you, Jake, I'm like a little animal. When I get my teeth into something I never let go. If your daughter's here, I'll track her down.
Intent_p1: Person1 is asserting their expertise and determination as a private detective to find Person2's missing daughter, despite the potential cost and suggesting that they are relentless in their pursuit.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to assert their authority and remind Person1 to be mindful of their language and conduct while working on the case.

Dialogue:
Person1: Answer the question!
Person2: Do you know how long all this will last? Not thirty years... or thirty thousand years... but thirty thousand years... and you'll be part of it. Ages will roll... Ages. And you'll be here... the two of you... eternally frozen... frozen... beautiful.
Person1: There must be somebody else up here. I can't believe that he's --
Person2: Let me sculpt you and I will show you where the others have gone.
Person1: That's better.  How do you want us?
Person2: Nude. Imagine, a pair.
Person1: It'll be all right...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing disbelief and concern about being alone and frozen forever, but eventually agrees to be sculpted nude by Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies a sinister intent to immortalize Person1 and their companion in a frozen state, suggesting a disturbing and potentially dangerous plan.

Dialogue:
Person1: Juno MacGuff called while you were out running. She wants to know if you're coming to her little coffeehouse performance on Saturday.
Person2: Thanks for the message.
Person1: You know how I feel about her.
Person2: You've mentioned it about fifty times.
Person1: I just hope you don't consider her a close friend.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern to Person2 about their relationship with Juno MacGuff and hopes that they do not consider her a close friend.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to subtly convey that Person1 has repeatedly expressed their feelings about Juno MacGuff and hopes that Person1 does not view Juno as a close friend.

Dialogue:
Person1: How would I get a loan, anyway?
Person2: You need collateral.
Person1: Like this?
Person2: That thing? Who'd you steal it from?
Person1: My daddy gave me this watch.
Person2: Yeah? Who'd he steal it from?
Person1: My daddy is dead so watch your mouth. You can say what you want about me, but don't be dragging my daddy into it. This watch means the world to me. Solid gold. Keeps perfect time.
Person2: Looks like a fake to me. Loan denied!
Intent_p1: Person1 is defending the authenticity and sentimental value of the watch given by their deceased father as collateral for a loan.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning the authenticity of the watch and denying the loan based on their suspicion.

Dialogue:
Person1: You're dying to come into my room, aren't you?
Person2: You want me so bad, why don't you invite me?
Person1: Too proud to admit you're crazy about me, Dr. Jones?
Person2: I think you're too used to getting you own way, Willie...
Intent_p1: Person1 is teasing Person2 about their mutual attraction and challenging them to make a move.
Intent_p2: Person2 is challenging Person1 to take the initiative and invite them into their room instead of playing games.

Dialogue:
Person1: My name is Slovo, Czech secret police. When you are here you are under my jurisdiction, you take my orders, you do what I say. If you become any kind of an inconvenience, I'll shoot you.
Person2: Here we go again.
Person1: You're here because your government is putting pressure on my government. This is an internal affair, a Czech affair, that you are interfering with. I will warn you once. Don't shit in my lawn. Get whatever information your government seeks and get our.
Person2: First of all, you should kill whoever sold you that suit. Two, I don't wanna be here either, so just step off. Three, if you had the authority to shoot me you would've done it by now, so just ease up on the machismo, bitch. Now that we've got that sorted out, I'm gonna get some rest.
Intent_p1: Person1 is asserting their authority as a member of the Czech secret police and warning Person2 to comply with their orders or face consequences.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing defiance and asserting their independence from Person1's threats and authority.

Dialogue:
Person1: "Let all who love me follow me"... Where does God get mentioned?  Come on Jeanne, be honest.  You fought for yourself, in your name.
Person2: I... I was defending myself as best I could!  Everyone has the right to defend themselves, don't they?  Or should I have let myself be killed?
Person1: No, no, you did fine.  I'd even say well done.  Besides, most of the ones you killed probably deserved it, don't you think?
Person2: No, I do not think so.  I don't think that killing each other will ever bring peace.
Person1: I agree...
Intent_p1: Person1's statement implies that they believe in leading by example and having their followers support them out of love rather than fear or force.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies a belief that killing others will not lead to peace.

Dialogue:
Person1: You're right. I remember Grandpierre looking through it. But there was nothing in it -- at least, nothing that the police thought was very important.
Person2: Can you remember anything at all?
Person1: Grandpierre asked me about an appointment Charles had -- on the day he was killed.
Person2: With whom? Where?
Person1: I think it only said where -- but I can't --
Person2: Think, Reggie, you've got to think -- it may be what we're looking for.
Person1: That money's not ours, Adam -- if we keep it, we'll be breaking the law.
Person2: Nonsense. We didn't steal it. There's no law against stealing stolen money.
Person1: Of course there is!
Person2: There is? Well, I can't say I think very much of a silly law like that. Think, Reggie -- please think -- what was written in Charles' notebook?
Person1: Well -- it was a place -- a street corner, I think. But I don't --  Hold it. I'm on.
Intent_p1: Person1 acknowledges that Grandpierre had looked through Charles' notebook, but found nothing significant according to the police, and recalls that Grandpierre had inquired about an appointment Charles had on the day he was killed.
Intent_p2: Person2 is encouraging Person1 to remember the details in Charles' notebook as it may be crucial to their investigation, dismissing the idea of breaking the law by keeping stolen money.

Dialogue:
Person1: We have to have a plan.
Person2: What sort of plan?
Person1: Our children cannot see us die first. If the Militia comes, you must hurry up to the roof. I will meet you there.
Person2: Please do not talk like this.
Person1: We have to. If I do not come, you must take them all by the hands and jump.
Intent_p1: Person1 is emphasizing the importance of having a plan to protect their children in case of danger.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern and discomfort with the grim and fatalistic discussion about potential dangers and actions to take in the face of a threat.

Dialogue:
Person1: Steve...what you tried to do today...you tried to take me up on a high mountain...I couldn't go all the way...I failed you...  Will you forgive me?  Have I lost you, Steve?  Have I...?
Person2: Well, maybe I was wrong, too... But there's no doubt, Susie, that we have to face some serious things...
Person1: No one's ever stood up to my brother the way you did.
Person2: But you didn't do much about it, Susie.  You walked out, and there I was...solo...and not too good at that.
Person1: I just didn't think that I could antagonize him, Steve -- for OUR sake, I mean.
Person2: Susie, I was there for OUR sake, too.  But what a world it would be if we were all afraid to learn to walk and talk because it might offend poppa!  By the way, I think your brother was completely responsible for the smears...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing regret for not fully supporting Person2 in standing up to their brother and seeking forgiveness for their actions.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that facing serious issues is necessary, and that avoiding confrontation for the sake of peace may not always be the best approach.

Dialogue:
Person1: Don't you remember you told me you loved me, baby...
Person2: Hey, I like this.
Person1: This album is all Carpenters covers by alt-rock bands. It's called If I Were a Carpenter. It is God. I'll rip a copy for you before you leave.
Person2: You don't have to do that.
Person1: It's the least I can do. What did you say your favorite band was?
Person2: I didn't. But it's a three-way tie between the Stooges, Patti Smith and the Runaways.
Person1: Yeah, I definitely need to make you some CDs. At least while my kid is hanging out in there.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their intention to make a copy of the album "If I Were a Carpenter" for Person2 as a gesture of kindness and is also planning to make CDs of music by their favorite bands for them.
Intent_p2: Person2 appreciates the gesture of receiving a copy of the album but politely declines the offer.

Dialogue:
Person1: Soon as we leave here.  Stop home and pick up what we need and go do it.
Person2: Give me a minute, talk to Buddy.
Person1: You got two minutes, that's all.  Make up your mind.
Person2: I wasn't asking permission.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a sense of urgency and decisiveness in their plan, emphasizing the need for quick action.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting their independence and decision-making authority in the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: Quiet.  Would I get the loans?
Person2: This time I imagine you would, yes.  Hmm...  With all this in mind, Mr. Kross, I can't logically make a formal bid on your company, can I?
Person1: You'd be initiating a financial battle you'd ultimately lose, Mr. Harris.
Person2: You're very right.  I think the best thing we could all do is go home.
Intent_p1: Person1 is warning Person2 that attempting to acquire their company would result in a financial loss for them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is acknowledging the potential financial risk and suggesting that it would be best for everyone to leave the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: You don't know the power of the dark side. I must obey my master.
Person2: I will not turn...and you'll be forced to kill me.
Person1: If that is your destiny.
Person2: Search your feelings, father. You can't do this. I feel the conflict within you. Let go of your hate.
Person1: It is too late for me, son. The Emperor will show you the true nature of the Force. He is your master now.
Intent_p1: Person1 is acknowledging their allegiance to their master and the dark side, expressing that it is too late for them to change.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to appeal to Person1's emotions and inner conflict, urging them to let go of their hate and not succumb to the dark side.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm telling you.  Don't you ever address me publicly in that tone. You'll work what and who I tell you to work.
Person2: Anybody in this department ever worked a serial killer case?  She's the expert.  I need help.
Person1: How about I put Nikko on it?
Person2: That's always your privilege, sir.
Intent_p1: Person1 is asserting their authority and control over Person2 by deciding who they should work with and how they should address them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is subtly reminding Person1 of their expertise and requesting their help on a specific case involving a serial killer.

Dialogue:
Person1: Dude, it's not like I haven't been trying to get laid.
Person2: This is different.  This is better. Think of when you're working out, Oz. You need a partner, someone to spot you.  Someone to keep you motivated.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration about their efforts to find a romantic partner and Person2 is encouraging them to see the benefits of having a supportive partner in various aspects of life.
Intent_p2: Person2 is emphasizing the importance of having a supportive partner in achieving goals and staying motivated.

Dialogue:
Person1: Where do you think he is, Mike.
Person2: We'll find him.
Person1: No.  I mean.  Not even your people should be involved.  Right?  It's too close now.
Person2: You could use a few of my prime troublemakers up here.
Person1: You think I'm staying?
Person2: There's already gonna be talk about how people close to you keep falling into canyons.
Person1: Well, can we make it one more.  Nowhere the heck near me.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern about keeping their people uninvolved in a dangerous situation and suggesting that any incidents should not be close to them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting that Person1 should consider using some of their associates to help with the situation, implying that it may be beneficial to have them involved despite the risks.

Dialogue:
Person1: I never believed you were a murderer.  I knew.  I knew you are a magico.  I have seen it in you.  It's in your spirit.
Person2: I'm tired, Diego.  Go to bed.
