Intent_p2: Person2 expresses a strong desire to go home and is feeling overwhelmed and distressed by the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...hell of a price for the country to pay.
Person2: ...take a long view.
Person1: ...what's the Long View?
Person2: Your guy gets four more years in Washington...  ...it's only Nine More Days.
Person1: Yes.  That's true.  But...
Person2: Wilfred.  We've got work to do...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern about the consequences of their actions and decisions on the country.
Intent_p2: Person2 is emphasizing the importance of focusing on the bigger picture and the long-term perspective despite the current challenges and time constraints.

Dialogue:
Person1: One of these days, you're going to wake up in the middle of the night and find that you've cut your throat.
Person2: How clumsy. I'd never forgive myself. Good night my dear.
Person1: You could have got in that room, just as you got in here. How do I know you didn't kill Larry?
Person2: With what motive?
Person1: Nastiness. You're nasty with words. Why wouldn't you be nasty with deeds once in a while? You hated him--and I know why.
Person2: He was very easy to hate. If you'll look in your mirror, when you are in a better temper- you'll know why.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing suspicion towards Person2, suggesting that they may have killed Larry out of hatred and nastiness.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that Larry was easy to hate, and Person1 should reflect on their own behavior to understand why.

Dialogue:
Person1: River Street? I thought we was going to the Garden.
Person2: I've got to cover a bet there on the way over. Anyway, it gives us a chance to talk.
Person1: Nothing ever stops you from talking, Charley.
Person2: The grapevine says you picked up a subpoena.
Person1: That's right... .
Person2: Of course, the boys know you too well to mark you down for a cheese-eater.
Person1: Mmhmm.
Person2: You know, the boys are getting rather interested in your future.
Person1: Mmhmmm.
Person2: They feel you've been sort of left out of things, Terry. They think it's time you had a few little things going for you on the docks.
Person1: A steady job and a few bucks extra, that's all I wanted.
Person2: Sure, that's all right when you're a kid, but you'll be pushing thirty pretty soon, slugger. It's time you got some ambition.
Person1: I always figured I'd live longer without it.
Person2: Maybe.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing contentment with a simple life and lack of ambition, despite others suggesting he should strive for more.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting to Person1 that it's time for him to have some ambition and strive for more in his life rather than just settling for a steady job and a few extra bucks.

Dialogue:
Person1: Come on, Fran -- don't be like that. You just going to sit there and keep bawling?  You won't talk to me, you won't tell me what's wrong --  Look, I know you think I'm stalling you. But when you've been married to a woman for twelve years, you don't just sit down at the breakfast table and say "Pass the sugar -- and I want a divorce." It's not that easy.  Anyway, this is the wrong time. The kids are home from school -- my in- laws are visiting for the holidays -- I can't bring it up now.  This isn't like you, Fran -- you were always such a good sport -- such fun to be with --
Person2: Yeah -- that's me. The Happy Idiot -- a million laughs.
Person1: Well, that's more like it. At least you're speaking to me.
Person2: Funny thing happened to me at the office party today -- I ran into your secretary -- Miss Olsen. You know -- ring-a-ding-ding? I laughed so much I like to died.
Person1: Is that what's been bothering you -- Miss Olsen? That's ancient history.
Person2: I was never very good at history. Let me see -- there was Miss Olsen, and then there was Miss Rossi -- no, she came before -- it was Miss Koch who came after Miss Olsen --
Person1: Now, Fran --
Person2: And just think -- right now there's some lucky girl in the building who's going to come after me --
Person1: Okay, okay, Fran. I deserve that. But just ask yourself -- why does a man run around with a lot of girls? Because he's unhappy at home -- because he's lonely, that's why -- all that was before you, Fran -- I've stopped running.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to explain to Fran that he is hesitant to bring up the topic of divorce due to the current circumstances and is reassuring her that his past actions are not reflective of his current feelings.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies a sense of sarcasm and bitterness towards Person1, highlighting their unhappiness and dissatisfaction in the relationship.

Dialogue:
Person1: What was I supposed to do?  I told the truth.  Why should the truth upset you?  It's not as if you're from a convent.
Person2: I want my money.  I'm getting out of here.  I don't want anything more to do with you.
Person1: Can we talk about this?  Can you just try to calm down?
Person2: Your goddamned friend, he thinks the only reason I'm with you is for the money.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning why telling the truth should upset Person2 and implies that Person2 is not as innocent as they claim to be.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and anger towards Person1's friend for assuming their relationship is based on money.

Dialogue:
Person1: What's this?
Person2: My apartment.
Person1: I knew I couldn't trust you. You told me you were taking me home.
Person2: Come on up for just a few minutes. We'll have just one drink, then we'll go.
Person1: No. I know the answer to that one.  I think you'd better take me home.
Person2: What's the matter? Afraid papa will spank?
Person1: No. No, I'm afraid papa isn't that much interested. He's too busy rushing off to Philadelphia to make stuffy, old speeches at stuffy, old bankers' meetings. Too busy closing big, important deals  I think I will have a drink.
Person2: Good for you. Come on.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing disappointment and frustration towards Person2 for not taking them home as promised and instead inviting them up for a drink, highlighting their lack of trust in Person2's intentions.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to persuade Person1 to come up to their apartment for a drink despite Person1's initial reluctance.

Dialogue:
Person1: Peter, if you want me to run your little camping trip, there are two conditions.  First -- I'm in charge, and when I'm not around, Dieter is.  Your job is to sign the checks, tell us we're doing a good job, and open your case of scotch when we have a good day.  Second condition -- my fee.  You can keep it.  All I want in exchange for my services is the right to hunt one of the tyrannosaurs.  A male.  Buck only.  Why and how are my business. If you don't  like either of those conditions, you're on your own.  Go ahead and set up your camp right here, or in a swamp, or in the middle of a rex nest, for all I care.  But I've been on too many safaris with rich dentists to listen to any more suicidal ideas.  Okay?
Person2: Okay.
Person1: Good lad.
Intent_p1: Person1 is setting clear conditions for running the camping trip, asserting their authority and requesting the right to hunt a male tyrannosaurus in exchange for their services.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement "Okay." indicates their agreement to the conditions set by Person1 for running the camping trip, including allowing Person1 to hunt a male tyrannosaurus in exchange for their services.

Dialogue:
Person1: See, now you've annoyed her.  You know she doesn't like you to touch me.  Does she, widdle wee fing!  Wuhve you so much!  Did you feed her?
Person2: Yes, I fed her.  If she says she's hungry, she's lying to you.  Again.
Person1: She doesn't lie!  You sure you fed her?
Person2: She lies all the time.  Why would I say I fed her if I didn't?
Person1: That's what I don't know.  Why would you lie?  That's the problem... I can't understand why anyone would lie.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing confusion and frustration about why Person2 would lie, as they cannot comprehend the reasoning behind dishonesty.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting that the cat is not hungry and that Person1's cat often lies about being hungry.

Dialogue:
Person1: Request; comprehensive electrical systems check.
Person2: Systems check positive.  Look, Elaine, I...
Person1: Request; life support systems check.
Person2: Life support check.  Elaine, it's obvious you've been ignoring me.  You're a woman. I can relate to that.
Person1: Request; self-analysis of ROK hardware and software systems regarding behavioral changes.
Person2: There's nothing wrong with me, Elaine. What about tonight -- just you and me.  We can be alone.  I can get rid of everyone else on the ship -- I've already proven that.
Intent_p1: Person1 is requesting various system checks while Person2 is trying to engage in a personal conversation with Elaine.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing a desire to be alone with Elaine and suggesting getting rid of everyone else on the ship to achieve that.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...We stood there and I kissed her for the last time. And she said, "If lose me, you'll know that I loved you --
Person2: Scottie --
Person1: -- and wanted to go on loving you." And I said, "I won't lose you."  But I did.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing the regret and sorrow of losing someone they loved deeply despite their assurance that they wouldn't.
Intent_p2: Person2 expresses concern for Person1 by calling out their name, indicating they are worried about the emotional impact of the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: When aid you get home last night...?
Person2: What were you talking about...?
Person1: Yyou look terrible.  You're exhausted. You practically live at the goddamn clinic.    Even pregnant women who aren't doctors know that You can't -
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concern about Person2's well-being and exhaustion, implying that they spend too much time at the clinic and need to take care of themselves.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning the topic of conversation and expressing confusion about the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: Yeah... Sounds like the Constitution to me. With a little of the Bill of Rights thrown in...
Person2: Inspector Brimmer, this is no joke During your surveillance have you seen any outside agitators? Professorial types? Communists?
Person1: No. I've seen Black men handing out bags of food. Having meetings. Patrolling the neighborhood. Having more meetings. They ain't...
Person2: They are carrying guns. They are threatening police officers. They are undermining the United States of America. And you Inspector Brimmer are not taking your duties seriously...
Intent_p1: Person1 is implying that the actions of the Black men in the neighborhood, such as handing out food and patrolling, are reminiscent of constitutional rights and not necessarily threatening.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern about the presence of armed individuals who are perceived as a threat to law enforcement and national security, and criticizing Inspector Brimmer for not addressing the situation adequately.

Dialogue:
Person1: What, did you see it work in some movie you got beat up in?
Person2: I have to ask you for that key.
Person1: What, the setup didn't work so you want the key back?
Person2: Catlett says if you don't open the locker the deal's off.
Person1: You serious? This is how you guys do business? I can't believe you aren't dead.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2's actions and expressing disbelief at their approach to handling the situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is requesting the key because Catlett has threatened to cancel the deal if the locker is not opened.

Dialogue:
Person1: Look, Rob.  If great sex was as important as you think it is, and if I was having great sex with him, then we wouldn't be lying here now. And that is my last word on the subject, okay?
Person2: Okay.
Intent_p1: Person1 is emphasizing that the lack of great sex in their relationship is a significant issue and a contributing factor to their current situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is acknowledging and accepting Person1's final statement on the importance of great sex in their relationship.

Dialogue:
Person1: Silly rabbit. My triumph isn't over her. It's over you.
Person2: Come again?
Person1: You were very much in love with her and you're still in love with her. But it amused me to make you ashamed of it. You gave up on the first person you ever loved because I called you names. Don't get me wrong, I'm flattered that you chose me over her, but please understand, I never loved you, Sebastian. You're just a toy. A little toy I play with. And now you've completely blown it with her. I think that's the saddest thing I've ever heard.  Cheers.
Intent_p1: Person1's intent is to reveal to Person2 that they manipulated them into giving up on their first love and choosing them instead, only to ultimately admit that they never truly loved Person2 and view them as a mere plaything.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing confusion and seeking clarification on the manipulative and hurtful actions of Person1 towards them and their past relationship.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...You know! For kids!
Person2: ...Why don't I just type this up...
Person1: Aww, naw, Amy, that won't be necessary. I shouldn't send it; she's just doing her job, I guess.
Person2: Well, I don't know; maybe she does deserve it. Maybe she should've come in to face you man to man.
Person1: Well, she probably had a deadline...
Person2: Sure, but -- she could still have gotten your side for the record!
Person1: Well, it's done now -- what's the use of grousing about it. Forget the letter, Amy, I just had to blow off some steam...
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing resignation and acceptance about not sending a letter to someone who was just doing their job, acknowledging that it's not worth dwelling on the situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting that the recipient of the letter should have had the opportunity to discuss the issue face-to-face before making a decision.

Dialogue:
Person1: Why do you feel the need to explore this side of your personality?
Person2: What are you talking about?
Person1: I'm talking about the kind of people you hang out with...about growing up, assuming responsibility of yourself.
Person2: I asked you to marry me. I'm ready for marriage. That's responsibility. That's growth.
Person1: I just think that at some point you're going to have to re-evaluate some of your friendships...
Person2: Who else?
Person1: Charles Moore for instants.
Person2: You don't like Moore? Since when?
Person1: It's not that I don't like him. But the wedding has really got me thinking and... I just keep myself opening up. Crowning. And I want you keeping up with me here.
Person2: What does Moore have to do with your growing?
Person1: I just don't see him in the big picture.
Person2: I've known him since Cub Scouts.
Person1: He's weird.
Person2: He's quiet.
Person1: He's weird.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing concerns about Person2's friendships and their impact on their personal growth and the future of their relationship.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to defend their friend Charles Moore against Person1's negative opinion by highlighting their long-standing friendship and emphasizing Moore's quiet nature.

Dialogue:
Person1: Where are you going?
Person2: I don't know.
Person1: When are you going to be back?
Person2: I don't know.
Person1: Well, until you know, you can't go.
Person2: Oh, okay.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing the condition that Person2 cannot leave until they have a clear plan for when they will return.
Intent_p2: Person2 is agreeing to wait until they have more information before proceeding with their plans.

Dialogue:
Person1: Forget it.
Person2: Come on, Josh... don't you want to see where he lives?
Person1: No.
Person2: But this guy is like a one-of-kind, rare butterfly, and we have to follow him back to his natural habitat...
Person1: You need counseling.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and disinterest in following someone to their home, suggesting that Person2's behavior is concerning.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to convince Person1 to follow someone to their home because they find them unique and interesting.

Dialogue:
Person1: I didn't get selected for the team again. I've been practicing so hard.
Person2: I saw how hard you worked, Kyle. Their decision doesn't reflect your effort.
Person1: Maybe I'm just not cut out for it. Nobody wants me anyway.
Person2: That's not true. Remember, rejection doesn't define your worth. It's just a part of the journey.
Person1: Thanks, Anna. It just feels like I'm always the one left behind.
Person2: You have your unique strengths. We'll find where they shine brightest.
Intent_p1: Person1 is feeling discouraged after not being selected for the team and expressing self-doubt about their abilities.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement conveys reassurance and encouragement to Person1, emphasizing that rejection does not determine their value and that they have unique strengths to discover and showcase.

Dialogue:
Person1: Anybody have a cigarette?  But seriously, do me a favor and Concorde me back to prison.  I don't care anymore.  I hope you have the receipts for the threads.
Person2: You go back, you won't be alone. You'll have a diabetic barkeep cellmate.  You're still young enough to have fun shanking child molesters for a pack of smokes, but "Alex" will go in knowing that the next time he gets out it'll be to attend his own funeral. Depressing.
Person1: You wouldn't risk the dime to call the police.  You have no proof.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a sense of resignation and hopelessness, suggesting a desire to return to prison and implying a lack of concern for consequences.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that returning to prison would mean facing dangerous and potentially deadly situations, highlighting the harsh reality of the consequences of criminal behavior.

Dialogue:
Person1: You don't seem excited, my little muffin.
Person2: Should I be?
Person1: Brides often are, I'm told.
Person2: I do not marry tonight.
Intent_p1: Person1 is implying that Person2 should be excited because brides are typically excited before their wedding day.
Intent_p2: Person2 is clarifying that they are not getting married that evening, hence questioning the necessity of being excited about it.

Dialogue:
Person1: What were you going to do? Gold dig him for a meal?
Person2: Why not? I'm hungry.
Person1: Eat a carrot.
Person2: Never!  I'm going in and ask him
Person1: If you do, I'll break your neck.
Intent_p1: Person1 is warning Person2 not to approach someone with the intention of using them for a meal.
Intent_p2: Person2 is defiant and determined to ask someone for a meal despite being told to eat a carrot instead.

Dialogue:
Person1: ... Somebody should shoot the little bastard.
Person2: I wanna fight just as dirty as he does.
Person1: ... Use his women.
Person2: ... Any information you have, Edgar. The sonofabitch is not gonna steal from me again!  Can you back me up on this?  Can I count on your support?
Intent_p1: Person1 is suggesting using the women associated with the person they are discussing as a means of retaliation or leverage.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing a desire to retaliate against someone who has wronged them and is seeking support from Person1 to take action.

Dialogue:
Person1: Come on, just sign the loan papers for me. You'd do it if you loved me.
Person2: Alice, tying love to financial obligations isn't fair or healthy. Love shouldn't be used as a manipulation tool.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to manipulate Person2 into signing loan papers by suggesting that their love for each other should be the reason for doing so.
Intent_p2: Person2 is emphasizing that using love as a means of manipulation in financial matters is unfair and unhealthy.

Dialogue:
Person1: There's one sure way to find out how you feel.
Person2: What's that?
Person1: Let me kiss you.
Person2: No.
Person1: You're not afraid are you?
Person2: Of course not, but...there are things we don't understand.
Person1: If we wait until we understand everything we'll be dead. Come on. You can learn more from one kiss than from years in school.
Person2: Well...I guess one is all right.
Intent_p1: Person1 is suggesting that experiencing a kiss can provide more insight and understanding than years of formal education.
Intent_p2: Person2 is hesitant about kissing because there are things they don't understand, but eventually agrees to one kiss.

Dialogue:
Person1: Don't mind him, Sheriff. Boy's just a bit slow, is all. He don't mean nothin' by it--
Person2: That the problem, son?  You Slow?
Person1: Otis, apologize to the Sheriff--
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to explain and excuse Otis's behavior to the Sheriff.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning Otis about his mental capabilities and implying that being slow might be an issue.

Dialogue:
Person1: Three years.  How long have we been in business?  Three years.  Does she get to meet your connection?  Was she good enough?
Person2: Shut up, Diego.  They're going to be here any minute.  I'm trying to concentrate.
Person1: I'm very angry with you, George.  Very angry.  You don't take me to California, but you take your bitch wife?  A woman? I understand you love her, but it was you and me who started this.  You and me.
Person2: What do you need my connection for, Diego?  What are you going to do with it?
Person1: What do I do with it?  Nothing.  It's for peace of mind.  It's for the principle.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and disappointment towards Person2 for not involving them in a business trip to California and prioritizing their spouse instead, emphasizing the importance of their partnership and loyalty.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to question Person1's motives and intentions for wanting to meet his connection.

Dialogue:
Person1: Ooohhhhhh! I made it all up! I never saw Beverly Sutphin in my life!
Person2: You'll pay for this, Marvin A. Pickles!  I'm turning your file over to the vice-squad!!  The prosecution rests, your honor.
Intent_p1: Person1 is admitting to fabricating information about Beverly Sutphin and acknowledging that they have never actually met her.
Intent_p2: Person2 is threatening to report Person1 to the authorities for making false claims and is declaring that the prosecution has presented its case.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm not playin' myself no mo'.
Person2: How you sound?
Person1: I won't do it anymore.
Person2: Manray, I'm very sorry about ya boy Cheeba and Sloan.  Believe me, it gave me no joy pulling ya coattail about her, just lookin' out for a brother.  I feel you, all this stuff happenin' at once but you can't let if affect your work.  You gotta be professional.
Person1: I'm always gonna be that.  But I ain't doing no more buck dancing.
Person2: No costume.  No blackface.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their decision to stop engaging in behavior that compromises their integrity and self-respect.
Intent_p2: Person2 is advising Person1 to avoid engaging in stereotypical or offensive behavior, such as wearing blackface or performing in a demeaning manner.

Dialogue:
Person1: No they won't.
Person2: Why not?
Person1: I'll talk to them.
Person2: Oh...Gooood!
Person1: I'll tell you what to say.
Person2: If I get you back to the lab, will you get out of my head?
Person1: If I'm real, they'll get me out. If I'm not, they'll treat you. Either way you'll be better off than you are now. You'll get a reward.
Intent_p1: Person1 is reassuring Person2 that they will handle the situation and ensure that they are taken care of.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing a desire to be free from a troubling situation by suggesting a potential solution.

Dialogue:
Person1: Am I wasting my time with you? When she sues to protect her privacy, she'll have to appear in a public courtroom to do it.
Person2: Long live the First Amendment.
Person1: Sometimes you have to tell a small lie to get to the bigger truth.  As for a photo -- if you can't do it, I know twelve million people who can.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing skepticism about the value of their conversation and highlighting the potential need for deception to uncover the truth and the availability of alternative options for obtaining a photo.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing support for the First Amendment, emphasizing the importance of free speech and the right to privacy.

Dialogue:
Person1: It's the same questions, Mrs. Little. Since the death of your husband --
Person2: Murder.
Person1: -- there is a serious question as to whether --
Person2: These are my children. Mine. And they ain't no question. None.
Person1: I think sometimes, Mrs. Little, candor is the only kindness.
Person1: All of your children are delinquent, Mrs. Little, and one, at least, Malcolm is a thief.
Person2: Get out.
Person1: Your control over your children, therefore --
Person2: Did you hear me?!
Person1: You'll regret this, Mrs. Little.
Person2: If you don't move out through that door, you're going to be past all regretting.
Intent_p1: Person1 is implying that Mrs. Little needs to face the truth about her children's behavior and take responsibility for their actions.
Intent_p2: Person2 is asserting their authority and demanding that Person1 leave immediately.

Dialogue:
Person1: You're lying.
Person2: The hell I am.
Person1: Yes you are. My stuff stinks. I know it. You said so yourself.
Person2: I never said that.
Person1: Yes you did. Last night. To your friend Crabtree. "Is he any good?" he said. And you said: "Not yet he isn't." I heard you myself.
Person2: I didn't mean it that way.
Person1: It's okay, Professor Tripp. Carrie, Howard, the others -- they're right. My stories are annoying. They go on and on and on, and the longer they go on the more annoying they become, until finally you just want to grab something heavy and --
Person2: Shut up, James. You're annoying. Carrie and Howard don't know what they're talking about, okay? The entire class combined -- including the lovely Hannah Green -- has about one tenth of one percent the talent you have, okay?
Intent_p1: Person1 accuses Person2 of lying about their opinion on Person1's work, leading to a discussion about the perceived quality of Person1's stories.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to reassure and uplift Person1 by expressing that they have more talent than the rest of the class combined, including the lovely Hannah Green.

Dialogue:
Person1: Secret Service Agent Carter.  This is my calling, Lee. Give me six months and I'll be in Washington protecting a white guy.
Person2: We both know you would never take a bullet for someone else.
Person1: They don't know that.  What are they gonna do, try and shoot the President during the interview?  I'll bet Isabella can pull some strings.  You saw the way she was staring at me.
Person2: She never even looked at you.
Person1: You're just jealous 'cos the girl picked me.  I'm tall, dark and handsome, you're third world ugly.
Person2: I am not third world ugly.  Women like me, they think I'm cute.  Like Snoopy.
Person1: Snoopy is about six inches taller than you.  I'm sorry, Lee, you never had a chance.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing confidence in their ability to become a Secret Service agent and protect a white person in Washington, dismissing concerns about taking a bullet and suggesting they can leverage connections to secure the position.
Intent_p2: Person2 implies that Person1 would not sacrifice themselves for someone else, highlighting their self-serving nature.

Dialogue:
Person1: My name is Jason Nesmith. I'm an actor. We're all actors.
Person2: Our dimwitted friends don't understand the concept of acting. They have no theater, no imagination these scientists.
Person1: We pretend...
Person2: Simpler.
Person1: We.. We lie.
Person2: Yes... You understand THAT, don't you, Mathesar?...
Intent_p1: Person1 is explaining to Person2 that as actors, they pretend and lie as part of their craft.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration that their friends, who are scientists, do not grasp the essence of acting and the concept of pretending or lying.

Dialogue:
Person1: Of course, I've had to make some additions for the new models, but not as many as you might think. Once you have your basic set it's then only a question of variation.
Person2: And you get into any car you want and just drive off?
Person1: Not any car. I like to keep a variety. I'm always looking for the new experience, like this one. I liked it.
Person2: Thank you. But when you take these cars don't you think you are wronging the owners?
Person1: What owners, Harold? We don't own anything. It's a transitory world. We come on the earth with nothing, and we go out with nothing, so isn't "ownership" a little absurd?
Person2: Still, I think you'd upset people and I'm not sure that's right.
Person1: Well, if some people are upset because they feel they have a hold on some things, then I'm merely acting as a gentle reminder - I'm sort of breaking it easy -- Here today, gone tomorrow, so don't get attached to things. Now, with that in mind, I'm not against collecting stuff...
Intent_p1: Person1's statement implies that they believe in the transient nature of possessions and are trying to remind others not to become too attached to material things.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies concern about the ethical implications of taking cars without permission and potentially upsetting the owners.

Dialogue:
Person1: Come on. We got a couple hours to eat and get some sleep.
Person2: I'll eat when I'm good and ready.
Person1: Kind of feeling your oats this morning. I haven't laid a hand on you for quite a while, but that doesn't mean you're too old.
Person2: What makes you think you're so almighty? Telling people what to do and how to act when you don't even know how yourself.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to encourage Person2 to eat and rest within the limited time available, implying that they should not delay unnecessarily.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and defiance towards Person1's attempts to control their actions and behavior.

Dialogue:
Person1: Like it?
Person2: Yes. It reminds me of home.
Person1: Where Superman's from? Krypton?
Person2: No. Argo City. It was on a chunk of rock that was part of Krypton once---but we moved it to inner space.
Person1: I'm sorry, I don't understand.
Person2: It's not important. The important thing is I'm here to find something and I think you can he1p me.
Person1: Come on, let's ride.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing confusion about the concept of Argo City and its connection to Krypton, but is willing to help Person2 with their quest.
Intent_p2: Person2 is indicating that the specific details about the origin of Argo City are not crucial, but rather they are focused on seeking help from Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: I'm sorry. She misunderstood, that's all.
Person2: But you tell me you had a pleasant visit and your mother says you were sullen and uncommunicative. Whom do you think I should believe?
Person1: Doctor, I hate to break this to you, but my mother is a little batty.
Person2: Frances, you're still filled with anxiety. You feel guilty and hostile toward your family and friends. Consequently, I didn't recommend your release at the staff review.
Person1: You what?
Person2: Mental illness is an elusive thing, and though I'm pleased you're feeling more... capable, it's perhaps unrealistic to expect you to be completely cured after so short a time. Don't you agree?
Intent_p1: Person1's statement implies that they believe their mother's perception of their behavior is inaccurate due to her being unreliable or eccentric.
Intent_p2: Person2 questions Person1's conflicting accounts of their behavior and expresses concern about their mental state, suggesting that their release may not be recommended due to ongoing issues.

Dialogue:
Person1: I do. I need a new sponsor.
Person2: Is that what you want?
Person1: Yeah.
Person2: A sponsor.
Person1: Yeah.
Person2: Mm... okay. Don't worry about it. Nobody'll mess with ya anymore. I'll take care of ya.
Person1: Nicky, please...
Person2: Yes, I will. It's what you want, isn't it? Huh?
Person1: Thank you. Yeah, yeah, yeah.
Person2: It's what you want?
Person1: Yeah. Uh-huh -
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a desire for a new sponsor and is grateful for Person2's offer to take care of them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is reassuring Person1 that they will take care of them and be their new sponsor, confirming if that is what Person1 wants.

Dialogue:
Person1: Are you saying that someone is paying you to be our maid and doesn't want us to know who he is?
Person2: Yes. I can live in or out just as you wish.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Person2 about being paid by someone to be their maid while keeping the identity of the employer a secret.
Intent_p2: Person2 is confirming that they have the flexibility to live either in or out of the house based on the preference of Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Thelma, if I die--
Person2: What?
Person1: I didn't say I'm going to die, but if I should--
Person2: Don't say that!  I don't want to hear you say that!
Person1: Thel, listen to me.  If, on the million to one shot that I should--  That anything should happen to me.  Would you take care of Billy?
Person2: Me?!  You want me to take care of Billy?!
Person1: I thought about it a lot and you're the only person I know that I trust with him.  I mean, if anything happened to me, he'd be okay with you.  You're a good mother.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their trust in Person2 to take care of Billy if anything were to happen to them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is surprised and touched by the trust placed in her by Person1 to take care of Billy if anything were to happen to Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: I've noticed you've been distant lately. What's going on?
Person2: It's just... I've been feeling out of place with everyone else. They don't seem to get me.
Person1: Neil, no one understands you like I do. Talk to me. Let me be there for you.
Person2: It's hard to explain. I just feel so different from everyone else.
Person1: It's okay to be different. And I'm here to help you through whatever you're feeling.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing understanding and reassurance to Person2, offering support and encouragement during a difficult time.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing feelings of being misunderstood and out of place among others.

Dialogue:
Person1: Easy, boy. Just an idea.
Person2: Well, thanks, but forget it.
Person1: You know, Paden, what makes all this work is me doing my job. The fellows you came to town with are causing some trouble. It's going to take a little straightening out. I have my responsibilities. I want you to understand. It has nothing to do with us.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to reassure Person2 that they have a responsibility to address the trouble caused by the group they came to town with, emphasizing that it is separate from their relationship.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing gratitude for the idea but ultimately rejecting it and emphasizing the importance of focusing on their own responsibilities and not getting involved in the trouble caused by others.

Dialogue:
Person1: I just thought if I saw you face to face, maybe it would help.
Person2: Did it?
Person1: It helped me realize one thing.
Person2: What?
Person1: You're a self-obsessed little cunt like your mother.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their disappointment and frustration with Person2 by pointing out their self-centered behavior.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning whether the face-to-face meeting helped Person1 come to a realization about them.

Dialogue:
Person1: Mookie, I always liked you.  Not the smartest kid, but you're honest. Don't make me dislike you.
Person2: Sal, I want my money.
Person1: Don't even ask about your money. Your money wouldn't even pay for that window you smashed.
Person2: Forget a window, Radio Raheem is dead.
Person1: You're right, a kid is dead, but Mook, this isn't the time.
Person2: Forget that. The time is now. You know I'm sorry 'bout Sal's Famous Pizzeria, but I gotta live, too. I gotta get paid.
Person1: We both do.
Person2: We all know you're gonna get over with the insurance money anyway! Ya know da deal.
Person1: Do we now?
Person2: Quit bullshitting.
Person1: You don't know shit about shit.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and warning Person2 not to push their luck or test their patience.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and urgency in wanting to be paid, highlighting the importance of their own needs despite the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: Maybe it's all the pressure, Jake. The money. Things like that. Or your wife.
Person2: Why do you bring her up?
Person1: 'Cause she's always on your mind.
Person2: When was the last time I said a word?
Person1: It has nothin' to do with talkin'.
Intent_p1: Person1 is suggesting that Jake's stress and pressure may be related to his wife, even if he doesn't talk about her.
Intent_p2: Person2 is questioning why Person1 brought up his wife, implying that just because he doesn't talk about her doesn't mean she's not on his mind.

Dialogue:
Person1: Miss Parsons, I have one additional question for you.
Person2: Sir?
Person1: Why did we not know about this sooner?
Person2: Sir?
Person1: I pay you a good deal of money to be my eyes and ears in Hollywood, do I not? If you cannot provide this simple service you are of no use to me.
Person2: Sir, I-
Person1: Please be quiet.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and disappointment towards Person2 for not informing them about something sooner and questioning their value as an informant.
Intent_p2: Person2 is being reprimanded for failing to inform Person1 about something promptly and is being reminded of their role as an informant in Hollywood.

Dialogue:
Person1: Sorry to take up your time like that Trevor. Don't work too hard. Oh, before I forget. I talked your neighbor out of pressing charges.
Person2: What?
Person1: The whackjob in the black lipstick who lives down the hall? She wanted you arrested for harassment. I told her to chill out and smoke a joint. I'd look the other way as long as she did you know?
Person2: Thanks.
Person1: We're all here for you Trevor.
Intent_p1: Person1 is informing Trevor that they intervened to prevent his neighbor from pressing charges against him for harassment and advised her to relax in exchange for not pursuing legal action.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing gratitude for Person1's intervention in preventing their neighbor from pressing charges.

Dialogue:
Person1: She's... ill. Confined to her room. It's practically living alone.
Person2: If this girl Mary Crane were here, you'd have no reason to hide her would you?
Person1: Of course not.
Person2: If she paid you well?
Person1: Now, look...!
Person2: Or if she had you say... gallantly protecting her... you wouldn't be fooled... you'd know she was just using you. Wouldn't you?
Person1: I'm not a fool! And I'm not capable of being fooled! Not even by women!
Person2: I didn't mean that as a slur on your manhood. I'm sorry.
Person1: That's all right. maybe she could have fooled me.  But...  She didn't fool my mother.
Person2: Your mother met her?  Can I talk to your mother?
Person1: No. I told you, she's confined...
Person2: Just for a moment. She might have picked up a hint you'd miss.
Person2: Sick old women are sharp. Come on, I won't disturb...
Person1: No! Just no!  I have one of those breaking points like any other man, believe it or not, and I'm near it. There's just so much pushing I can take and I think...
Person2: All right!  Might save me a lot of leg-work if I could just talk to your mother.  But I'd need a warrant for that, won't I?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and resistance towards allowing Person2 to speak with their confined, ill mother, indicating a breaking point and a reluctance to cooperate further.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to persuade Person1 to allow them to talk to Person1's mother, suggesting that she might have valuable information that could help in the investigation.

Dialogue:
Person1: Nike specials. Two hundred bucks.
Person2: Two hundred bucks?? Are you crazy?
Intent_p1: Person1 is offering a special deal on Nike products for two hundred dollars.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing disbelief and shock at the high price of the Nike specials mentioned by Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: It's been five minutes and I'm packing to leave again.  I can't believe this.
Person2: That's right, your life is Shit, and I'm to blame.  It's that simple.
Intent_p1: Person1 is frustrated and disappointed with the situation and is expressing disbelief at having to leave again after only five minutes.
Intent_p2: Person2 is acknowledging their role in causing distress in Person1's life.

Dialogue:
Person1: Your sister said she didn't know where you were so you shouldn't write to her with return address if you're hiding.
Person2: Did you hurt her?
Person1: You know me...I never hurt anybody. Where's the money?
Intent_p1: Person1 is denying any wrongdoing and is more concerned about the money than the accusation of hurting Person2's sister.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing concern about the possibility of Person1 hurting their sister and is seeking clarification on the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: I don't remember her as having brown eyes.
Person2: Benjamin?
Person1: Yes?
Person2: Will you unzip my dress?
Intent_p1: Person1 is indicating that they do not recall the person in question having brown eyes.
Intent_p2: Person2 is changing the subject and redirecting the conversation to a different topic.

Dialogue:
Person1: Misery's Return?
Person2: I know you didn't mean it when you killed her, and now you'll make it right.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning if the return of misery is inevitable due to their past actions.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing belief in Person1's ability to rectify a past mistake and seek redemption for their actions.

Dialogue:
Person1: I do love a good check mate.
Person2: What do you want?
Person1: Come with me and I'll let her live.
Person2: You think I care about her?  I'm the only one who's sure to walk out of here.
Intent_p1: Person1 is confident in their ability to outmaneuver Person2 and is using the safety of another person as leverage in their negotiation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing their lack of concern for the person mentioned and asserting their confidence in their ability to survive the situation.

Dialogue:
Person1: This is why you don't show work in progress.
Person2: Norther, do you ever regret not making it to Paris?
Person1: I can't imagine any place better than here.
Person2: You're a poet. You oughta be able to. And maybe if you'd seen more, you could.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing contentment with their current location and believes that there is no better place than where they are.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting that Person1's lack of exposure to different places might limit their ability to appreciate other locations and experiences.

Dialogue:
Person1: You said we do appearances together, or not at all.'
Person2: I didn't say that.  I said "wouldn't it be great if we could always, work together." That's what I said.
Intent_p1: Person1's intent is to clarify that they did not say they would only do appearances together, emphasizing the desire to always work together.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to clarify that they did not make the statement about only doing appearances together, but rather expressed a desire to always work together.

Dialogue:
Person1: Oh, please.  I know what's coming, now.  "Let me help you..."
Person2: Do anything you want to me.  I give myself to you.  Only put the knife down.  Isn't this what you always wanted?  I know it's what we all want, to love and to loved.  I could love you.  You could work together in some safe place, learn to really understand you, help you, give you some peace of mind, some happiness...
Person1: Back in the driver's seat again, Doctor?  That old dream -- study us to see what makes us sick.  So you can find a cure -- they'd name it after you?  Death is the only cure for people like me.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing skepticism and resistance towards the idea of being studied and cured by Person2, implying that death is the only solution for them.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies a willingness to submit to the other person's desires and offers love and support in exchange for safety and understanding.

Dialogue:
Person1: I want to ask you a big favor, Gordon. Please drop the Bluestar deal.
Person2: Now tell me, why would I want to do that?
Person1: Because I don't want to see him hurt.
Person2: Don't worry Sunshine. Bud and I had a little talk. We came to an understanding.  I want you to go back to him. Soothe him. Help keep his head straight. Okay?
Person1: I can't...and I won't.
Person2: Come on, we both like Buddy. But this bleeding heart puppy love act is over the top... It doesn't fit.
Person1: Maybe it does. Don't patronize me Gordon.
Person2: You and I are the same, Darien. We're smart enough not to buy into the oldest myth running: love... A fiction created by people who got nothing to keep them from jumping out of windows.
Person1: You're really twisted, Gordon. You're incapable of giving to anybody because deep down inside you there's a poverty that every last dollar in the world won't fill.
Person2: Ooh ooh, tough talk from a scared little girl all wrapped in a pretty grown-up package. Does this mean you're ready to cut the umbilical cord and step out into the world on your own? Because, Darien, if you're through with me, you're through with everything I'm a part of.
Intent_p1: Person1 is asking Person2 to drop the Bluestar deal because they don't want to see someone named Buddy get hurt, but Person2 is trying to convince Person1 to go back to Buddy and help him, implying that their relationship is at stake.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that love is a myth created by those who lack fulfillment and that both Person1 and Person2 are smart enough not to believe in it.

Dialogue:
Person1: Ow, you're hurting me!
Person2: Listen guy, you're embarassing me in front of my friends!  You know how I get mad when I get embarassed.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing pain and discomfort, while Person2 is warning them about potentially triggering their anger by embarrassing them in front of others.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and warning Person1 about the consequences of embarrassing them in front of others.

Dialogue:
Person1: He wants us.
Person2: Aaahhnnnahnnnn.
Person1: What do you suppose for?
Person2: Aaaaannnnnuuunnnuhhhhh?
Person1: Did you do something to get us into trouble again?
Person2: Aannnnaahhnn.
Person1: Did you howl off-key at the moon again?
Person2: Aannnnaahhnn.
Person1: I can't remember doing anything wrong either.
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning if Person2's actions have caused trouble or attracted attention.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to communicate through nonsensical sounds that they are innocent and did not do anything wrong.

Dialogue:
Person1: I want to see you, Terry.
Person2: You got eyes. I'm right in front of you.
Person1: Now don't give me a hard time.
Person2: What do you want from me, Father.
Person1: Your gun.
Person2: Mind your own business, Father.
Person1: This is my business.
Person2: Why don't you go and chase yourself?
Person1: Give me that gun.
Person2: You go to hell.
Person1: What did you say?
Person2: You go to
Intent_p1: Person1 is demanding the gun from Person2.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing frustration and defiance towards Person1's demands.

Dialogue:
Person1: Maybe he's just a kooky guy who likes doing something kooky like that.
Person2: Maybe... why do you ask?
Person1: I'm thinking of investing with him. He worries me.
Person2: Why?
Person1: Maybe he's too flighty and irresponsible. That's why I asked if he was a fairy.
Person2: I don't know. He's a hairdresser.
Person1: You suggested it, don't you think it's a good idea?
Person2: Yes, but... I thought...
Person1: What?
Person2: That you were just indulging me.
Person1: No, doll, I listen to you. And if a deal loses money that's not so bad either if it's handled right.
Intent_p1: Person1 is considering investing with someone who they find eccentric and potentially unreliable, but they are open to the idea as long as the investment is managed properly.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement suggests doubt about the investment decision and questions the sincerity of Person1's intentions.

Dialogue:
Person1: An evil vet?
Person2: No. Maybe, like, work in a petting zoo or something.
Person1: An evil petting zoo?
Person2: You always do that!  Anyways, this is really hard, because, you know, my Dad is really evil.
Intent_p1: Person1 is jokingly suggesting the idea of an evil petting zoo, which leads Person2 to bring up their own personal struggles with their father.
Intent_p2: Person2 is suggesting a less sinister job for the concept of an "evil vet" by proposing working in a petting zoo instead.

Dialogue:
Person1: Finish your tour?
Person2: And anxious to get started.  What is this, mostly malaria?
Person1: Yes- but their suffering is only transitory- once they except God into their hearts, He will vanquish all pain.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a belief that the suffering caused by malaria can be alleviated by accepting God into their hearts.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing eagerness to begin their work and questioning if the main issue they will be dealing with is malaria.

Dialogue:
Person1: You see, Wilhelm, I'm talking about ordinary, everyday reasons. Which is why I want to discuss your private life.  How many illegitimate children do you have?
Person2: Major, I don't see how this line of questioning could...
Person1: David, what are you Counsel for the Defence now?  Did you hear the question?
Intent_p1: Person1 is questioning Wilhelm about his private life and the number of illegitimate children he may have.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing confusion and resistance towards the invasive and inappropriate line of questioning about Wilhelm's private life.

Dialogue:
Person1: Whoever tossed this place wants you.  And I'm looking to stay outta the line of fire.
Person2: How's this about me?
Person1: They lifted my wallet to make it look like a robbery.  But there's a bug in my computer keyboard, a tap on the phone and a mike in the light fixture.
Person2: Like you said, maybe somebody's tracking one of your investigations.
Person1: Hardware's too sophisticated.  It's gotta be the government.  And why do I think they're looking for you?
Person2: You're crazy.
Person1: I'm you, I take that money and get outta town while you can.
Intent_p1: Person1 is warning Person2 that they are being targeted by someone who has sophisticated surveillance equipment, likely the government, and advises them to leave town with the money they have.
Intent_p2: Person2 suggests that someone may be tracking one of Person1's investigations, leading to the suspicion that the government is involved and potentially looking for Person2.

Dialogue:
Person1: So you've not lit the last four boilers then?
Person2: No, but we're making excellent time.
Person1: Captain, the press knows the size of Titanic, let them marvel at her speed too. We must give them something new to print. And the maiden voyage of Titanic must make headlines!
Person2: I prefer not to push the engines until they've been properly run in.
Person1: Of course I leave it to your good offices to decide what's best, but what a glorious end to your last crossing if we get into New York Tuesday night and surprise them all.  Retire with a bang, eh, E.J.?
Intent_p1: Person1 is encouraging Person2 to push the engines of the Titanic to achieve a record-breaking speed on its maiden voyage to make headlines and retire with a memorable achievement.
Intent_p2: Person2's intent is to prioritize caution and proper engine maintenance over pushing the engines to achieve a faster speed for the Titanic's maiden voyage.

Dialogue:
Person1: Just imagine somebody like your quasi-fat, goody-good friend Betty Finn doing a Crest commercial. No one would buy Crest.
Person2: Don't tell me. Crest would be stained with loserness.
Person1: Yeah, and who wants that on their teeth?
Intent_p1: Person1 is mocking the idea of their friend Betty Finn doing a Crest commercial by suggesting that her image would not be appealing to consumers.
Intent_p2: Person2 is sarcastically implying that if their friend Betty Finn were to do a Crest commercial, the brand's reputation would be negatively impacted by her perceived lack of coolness or popularity.

Dialogue:
Person1: Easy, hon, I was just looking for fun details --
Person2: Oh, well, why didn't you say so? And oh, I don't know if you're interested in this detail, but I was just about to tell you that I love him.  I love him, and I don't care what you think.  I love him for the guy he wants to be, and I love him for the guy he almost is. I love him.
Intent_p1: Person1 is casually expressing their interest in fun details.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing their deep love for someone and asserting that they don't care about others' opinions on the matter.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...Paulie, why didn't you tell me you were bringing him home?! Look at me, I'm not ready for this.
Person2: Like it would make a difference if you were, right? This guy's a friend and now he's takin' ya out.
Person1: No... I can't!
Person2: Ya, ya goin' outta the bedroom an' I don't wanna know from nothin'.
Person1: Paulie, please --
Person2: Hey, I want ya out instamaticly. -- I'm sicka lookin' at ya hangin' around like a friggin' spider -- Go out -- Live! Do, enjoy life.
Person1: ...Like you?
Person2: Don't get wise with me. I want ya to stop bein' a loser.
Person1: I can't go out.
Person2: Why?
Person1: Paulie, it's Thanksgiving. I've gotta turkey in the oven.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing their reluctance to go out because they have a turkey in the oven for Thanksgiving.
Intent_p2: Person2 is encouraging Person1 to go out and enjoy life instead of staying at home, but Person1 reveals they can't go out because they have a turkey in the oven for Thanksgiving.

Dialogue:
Person1: ...the lease, the phones, the cars...layers of false ident. Would take the FBI weeks.  How long did it take them?  Three hours? Four?  This means, "We can reach out and touch somebody."  Like Bad Teleflora.
Person2: ...even if they could run the identities you built to EPIC, all they'll find is more cover... Trust what you built.  It's quality, girl.  We're cool...
Person1: ...you are trying to reassure me because you know when people get anxious, they make mistakes. You're worried about me.  Do not be.  I am careful.  I am cool.  I got Trudy, backup, whatever.  You worry about you.  Because you are the ones who are in denied territory, not me.  If your focus is on me, you'll miss something coming at you.  That's how people slip up. Get hurt.  And I'd die if anything happened.  You worry about you. You and Sonny...are in the dangerous place.  I'm fine...
Intent_p1: Person1 is reassuring Person2 that they are careful and have everything under control, advising them to focus on their own safety and not worry about them, as they are not in a dangerous situation.
Intent_p2: Person2 is reassuring Person1 about the quality of the false identities they created and advises them to trust their work and not worry, emphasizing that they are the ones in a potentially risky situation, not Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Operator...
Person2: Operator! Listen, this is an emergency! I have to make this call, but I don't have a dime -- all I got is a nickel -- but you gotta connect me --
Person1: Sir, it only costs a nickel.
Person2: What?
Person1: Local calls cost five cents. What number do you want?
Intent_p1: Person1 is informing Person2 that local calls only cost five cents and is ready to connect them to the desired number.
Intent_p2: Person2 is urgently trying to make a call but doesn't have enough change, and Person1 reassures them that the call only costs a nickel.

Dialogue:
Person1: Basquiat, those are my best clothes!!! What are you doing?
Person2: C'mon, baby, I painted them for you. They're beautiful now.
Person1: I'm going to my parents this weekend. What am I going to wear?  How could you do that to me?
Intent_p1: Person1 is upset that Person2 painted their best clothes without permission, leaving them with nothing to wear for an upcoming visit to their parents.
Intent_p2: Person2 is trying to reassure Person1 that the painted clothes are now beautiful and suitable for wearing, despite Person1's initial reaction.

Dialogue:
Person1: You're Anya Rosson, aren't you? I've heard of you back in New York.
Person2: Sorry I can't return the compliment.
Person1: You were indiscreet enough to leave your gloves in my apartment one evening--  --and he was gentleman enough to boast why you'd been there and show me a snapshot of you.
Person2: I don't understand.
Person1: I think you do.
Intent_p1: Person1 is implying that Person2 was seen in their apartment with someone else, and that Person2 knows exactly what they are referring to.
Intent_p2: Person2 is being confronted with evidence of their actions and is being indirectly accused of being involved in a situation they may not want to acknowledge.

Dialogue:
Person1: Is this being recorded?
Person2: This is just an informal discussion.
Person1: Are you recording it?
Person2: What does it look like?
Person1: It looks like he's writing everything down.
Person2: That's because he is. Does that upset you?
Person1: No. Why should it?
Person2: Well, then?
Person1: I've never seen any of these men before.
Person2: Take another look at these two.
Person1: I don't know them.
Person2: And if I told you their car was parked outside, would that surprise you?
Person1: Yes, I suppose so.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing surprise and curiosity about the situation and the presence of unknown individuals.
Intent_p2: Person2 is subtly implying that the conversation is being recorded without explicitly stating it.

Dialogue:
Person1: He couldn't look at me.  But I looked at him.  Right at him.  His secret was mine now.  We used to share it.  But not anymore.  Now, I owned it completely.
Person2: Well, okay.  I'll take you about nine-thirty in the morning.  That's okay with you?
Person1: Great.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a sense of power and ownership over someone else's secret that they used to share, but now it belongs solely to them.
Intent_p2: Person2 is confirming the time for a meeting or appointment with Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Wait I...
Person2: You were paid to take me out!  By -- the one person I truly hate.  I knew it was a set-up!
Person1: It wasn't like that.
Person2: Really?  What was it like?  A down payment now, then a bonus for sleeping with me?
Person1: I didn't care about the money.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to convey that their actions were not motivated by money.
Intent_p2: Person2 is expressing disbelief and anger at the idea that Person1 may have been paid to take them out on a date, questioning if there was a financial incentive for a romantic encounter.

Dialogue:
Person1: See! The big guy likes it.
Person2: I just saw the woman I'm going to marry, I know it. But then I lost her.
Person1: Tough break. Most men have to get married before they lose their wives.
Person2: I'm going to spend the rest of my life looking for her. That or die alone.
Person1: Jesus, kid.  Let me guess. Real pretty, blonde hair, blue hat?
Person2: Yes!
Person1: I know her uncle. Friends of the family.
Person2: Who is she? Where does she live?
Person1: Kid. Don't waste your time. She's out of your league.
Intent_p1: Person1 is trying to convey to Person2 that the woman he is searching for is out of his league and advises him not to waste his time pursuing her.
Intent_p2: Person2 expresses his strong belief that he has found the woman he wants to marry, but Person1 discourages him by implying that the woman is out of his league.

Dialogue:
Person1: All right, look.  I can make it Right, I can make this up to you, Mattie.  I can, I swear.
Person2: Will you go to her and tell her Right in front of me she's Nothing to you?  Right out loud so I can hear?  Tell her she's Nothing, tell her she's nobody, Just dirt?  Will you do that?
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing a willingness to make amends and promises to make things right with Mattie.
Intent_p2: Person2 is challenging Person1 to confront the truth and acknowledge the hurtful reality of their actions towards Mattie.

Dialogue:
Person1: Uh, you first.
Person2: C'mon, Beavis, just start running really fast when you hit the ground. It'll work.
Person1: Okay. I'll go right after you.
Intent_p1: Person1 is agreeing to follow Person2's suggestion to start running really fast when they hit the ground.
Intent_p2: Person2 is jokingly suggesting a reckless action to Person1.

Dialogue:
Person1: Hey!  I'm getting a little tired of this.
Person2: You volunteered, didn't you?  Aren't we paying you for this?
Person1: Yeah, but I didn't know you were going to give me electric shocks.  What are you trying to prove?
Person2: I'm studying the effect of negative reinforcement on ESP ability.
Person1: I'll tell you the effect!  It pisses me off!
Person2: Then my theory was correct.
Intent_p1: Person1 is expressing frustration and surprise at being subjected to electric shocks as part of a study on the effect of negative reinforcement on ESP ability.
Intent_p2: Person2's statement implies that the negative reinforcement of electric shocks was intentionally used to study its impact on ESP ability.
